Landmark came highly recommended and we have not been disappointed.
There has been turn over with staff which is part of the game with such a large company. Each manager has been attentive and responsive to our needs.
We feel lucky to have the help of Landmark.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Barbara, thank you so much for this amazing feedback about Landmark and out team here. We have enjoyed having you as a client and appreciate your business.

google_reviews.author: Nick Cafarelli
google_reviews.review:
Amber has been AWESOME throughout my entire rental process from start to finish!

She was responsive whenever I called - never ran into a situation where she didnt return a call or return a voicemail, which made this entire process go as smooth as a cross country move can be!

I honestly dont think I could have done this alone if it wasnt for Amber - you will be blessed and fortunate if you are able to work with her!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Nick, thank for the 5 stars and the very kind feedback!

google_reviews.author: A.
google_reviews.review:
Our apartment complex was recently acquired by Landmark, and honestly, I'm glad they were. They have been super easy to work with, all of their policies are reasonable. We recently had a major appliance go out, and we were able to get it replaced quickly, easily, and with a better quality appliance than was originally in the apartment.

Tangent about stoves:
The stoves I've had in apartments for the past 5+ years haven't had timers, oven windows, any of it. Our old one one didn't even have a real drawer in the bottom, just a panel. It definitely felt like they were just putting the cheapest option in they could because it's an apartment so whatever.
Cut to now. Our new oven arrives and I'm losing my mind because it has a clock/timer. Then I notice it has an oven light/window. Then I saw the literal warming drawer underneath. I'm just...losing my mind for this decent quality oven. It's not like they got something top of the line, but they got something nice enough to actually have in your home. It is such a nice upgrade and I didn't realize how much I missed having a decent, sturdy stove in my home  so happy. Thank you Landmark!

ownerResponse.text: Hi A., thank you for the 5 stars! We are so glad you have had a great experience with our staff here at Landmark and happy that we could replace your oven!

google_reviews.author: Carlos Quintero
google_reviews.review: The people Ive encountered so far have been professional and friendly. Im impressed. Theyve made my application process go smoothly and I look forward to being one of their tenants.

google_reviews.author: Alyssa Friddle
google_reviews.review: I dont recommend landmark! If youre wanting a easy non stressful experience while trying to find an apartment dont choose landmark! I have been patient with landmark but then continue to disappoint & leave me frustrated! They dont answer the phones, dont return calls & they waste your time. Because they dont answer the phone I have had to make time out of my day to go in and schedule showing because there site is terrible! & guess what we go in to schedule a showing and about 10 minutes after leaving they cancel the showing because apparently there is already a holding fee on the apartment. It would be nice to let us know that before we walk out and waste our time! Thanks landmark for contributing to stress while trying to find an apartment.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Alyssa, thank you for the feedback. If you have any or other specific items, you would like to address please feel free to reach out to our Director of Human Resources at Stephanie@visitlandmark.com with your concerns.

google_reviews.author: Josephine Garcia Mata
google_reviews.review: The application and approval process with Landmark has been enjoyable. All of my questions and concerns have been addressed in a professional and fairly prompt manner. Im especially appreciative of my interactions with Delaney whom I was texting back and forth with. She was constantly available to help in a courteous and friendly manner. She even went out of her way a time or two which Im truly grateful for. So far so good!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Josephine, thank you so much for the kind words and the 5 stars!!

google_reviews.author: Carmie H
google_reviews.review: To all the people rating them 4-5 stars and only having gone through the application move in process youre in for a rude awakening. Landmark made my living experience hell. My property manager Grace in particular was rude, condescending and unprofessional. They waited until two days past rent was due to apply our last months rent and my roommates money got automatically taken from her account. When I called to ask if we could have the money back Grace just kept threatening that if the house wasnt clean we wouldnt get the money back. Not only did they have no right to keep that money but it would be completely illegal to do that. They just want to take advantage of college students who are first time renters.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Carmie, we appreciate your feedback and we can only address some of your concerns and we know that the system sometimes does have a glitch where it doesn't prorate the rent for the last month and if you have an autopay set up on your portal it will charge that form of payment on the date it was set up to charge because you would need to go in your portal and manually stop the autopay. We do appreciate your review and this feedback helps us improve ourselves as a company, thank you.

google_reviews.author: Sarah A
google_reviews.review: No comment on maintenance requests, however the shower/tub switch was stuck on so shower head only spouted water, upon move in. We rented the apartment sight unseen, since we moved out of California. Upon arrival, every single door in the apartment had some kind of patching over a hole, multiple stains on the carpet, broken window fixtures, etc. We meticulously documented every thing and emailed photos and videos, and gave them a thumb drive with more photos. When I'd tell people we were renting from Landmark, the consensus was "They don't like giving back deposits". We moved out mid-July and received a fraction of our deposit a month later. Immediately we resent all the evidence to back up that most of the charges were already exisiting. The last email received was December 1st, saying that we'd receive a revised move out, which we haven't. We have been extremely patient and understanding but this is incredibly unprofessional.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Sarah, thank you for your feedback! I know that our accounting team was a little backed up on finishing up the security deposit revisions/disputes and I can see that your second check was mailed out on 1/20. I am hoping you have received that by now and if not feel free to email amber@visitlandmark.com and I will personally follow up on it for you!

google_reviews.author: Jordan Wolcott
google_reviews.review: Leslie is a fantastic point of contact at Landmark Real Estate. I had a number of unique questions/concerns about the process of signing my lease. Leslie addressed my questions same day and provided me with any and all resources I needed to be successful using Landmark's online portal/application. My experience was awesome working with Leslie and her team!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Jordan, thank you for the 5 stars and the really kind words about Leslie!!!

google_reviews.author: Alexandria Scott
google_reviews.review:
Honestly wish I could give 0 stars. Luckily, my roommate and Is lease just ended with Landmark. I would have written this review sooner, but our property manager, Grace, constantly threatened us with the loss of our security deposit. When we would call to ask simple questions or text her, she would be extremely condescending and rude, always threatening to take our money and potentially more.
Out of all my years of renting properties, I have never had anyone as horrible and blatantly rude as Grace. One of my roommates moved out early and when we called to ask about details and how the remainder of our lease would go with only two of us left in the unit, she told us to grow up and figure it out ourselves because that is not her problem. The last month we were in our unit, we were automatically charged for rent despite already having paid first and last months rent when we moved in. When we called Grace to ask about when the money would be returned because it was not our fault, it was landmarks; she told us that we should not have paid (we didnt, they took our money), and that we might not even get the money back depending on how our unit looked on move out. She didnt even answer our questions, she just kept saying to not count on getting our money back. The constant threats of them taking our money made our living experience even more unbearable. As if our property wasnt disgusting and unlivable enough.
We were previously with Lakeway who also has a horrid reputation in Bellingham, but Landmark is definitely worse. Grace has no business working as a property manager and made us feel unsafe asking any and all questions about our property. If she had not been our property manager, our experience here would have probably been pretty good. If you can avoid it, DO NOT rent from Landmark, they will take your money and never answer your maintenance requests.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Alexandria, we have taken your feedback seriously and have taken the time to review your files including all emails and text conversations, however we can not review any phone conversation as they are not recorded. Overall, I can only address some of your concerns and I know that the system sometimes does have a glitch where it doesn't prorate the rent for the last month and if you have an autopay set up on your portal it will charge that form of payment on the date it was set up to charge because you would need to go in your portal and manually stop the autopay. The security deposit was mailed out on 9/15 and you should have received that by now and looks like you got your deposit and the credit on your ledger back minus some minor cleaning and maintenance.  We do appreciate your review and this feedback helps us improve ourselves as a company, thank you.

google_reviews.author: Leigha Staffenhagen
google_reviews.review: While I can't speak to how others have been treated, I have had nothing but a positive experience with Landmark so far. Our maintenance requests were filled promptly, paying rent is super easy, and the property manager we work with is awesome. She emails back quickly, and always answers my questions and gets back to me.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you so much for this, Leigha! Renting a home in Bellingham should be a pleasant experience; we're glad to know you are happy. Your kind words will be shared with your Landmark representative so she know's she's doing a great job!

google_reviews.author: Rayne Luthi
google_reviews.review: Tia was so helpful! She was very knowledgeable and answered all of my questions. Checking out this apartment was such a smooth experience.

google_reviews.author: Casey Coles
google_reviews.review: Living in Bellingham the past few years Ive had the pleasure of renting with Landmark.  Im absolutely pleased with their services and staff.   One staff member in particular, Marianna she has been the most wonderful property manager Ive had the pleasure of dealing with and is just an incredible person inside and out.  She has been extremely helpful and professional through out the whole process.  Shes gone out of her way to answer any questions Ive had and the list goes on.  Thank you so much for your kindness and professionalism.  I will most definitely rent from landmark again in the future because of Marianna.

ownerResponse.text: Casey, thanks for the five star review. We are lucky to have Marianna!

google_reviews.author: Quinn Pedersen-Wilson
google_reviews.review: Did not communicate well at all. Building we were going to move into was sold. We had signed a lease and paid a deposit. Go to get the keys and they say we dont run that property any more go try the desk there. Didnt give the new people any of our information, they had almost rented it out to someone new cause they didnt know we existed! They still send us emails about our PSE info lmao. Very unhappy very unhelpful and unprofessional. At a previous unit they didnt respond to a maintenance request for months and it was never resolved before we moved away. They take your money for carpet cleaning but last house we rented from them the carpet smelled of rancid beer and was obviously filthy, wonder where that money goes.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Quinn, thank you for the feedback. If you have any other specific items, you would like to address please feel free to reach out to our Director of Human Resources at Stephanie@visitlandmark.com with your concerns.

google_reviews.author: Isaiah Adams
google_reviews.review: Ocean at the front desk is awesome to work with shes quick an is always nice

google_reviews.author: Taylor manoske
google_reviews.review: So far so good, changing units so we will see how much of our deposit we get back. The apartments are cheap and feel safe! I'll update my review if they make this difficult, so hopefully it goes smoothly. Amy the property manager is pretty helpful! And quick to get stuff fixed.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Taylor, Have no fear! All tenants, including those switching units are entitled to a full refund less carpet cleaning, as long as the unit is left clean and there is no damage beyond normal wear and tear. Hope this helps ease some of your concerns. Thank you for the kind review, we really appreciate it!

google_reviews.author: Russ Robinson
google_reviews.review: I haven't dealt with many property management companies, but I have dealt with many businesses in service industries extensively. The service, response and lack of any caring  that I have observed  from Landmark is jarring. The paperwork is meant to catch you and the fee's if left unchecked could run a person into the ground. Take the time to make sure EVERYTHING gets documented and read everything you asked to sign carefully. No refunds for application fee's. Money grabbers

ownerResponse.text: Hi Russ, thank you for the feedback. If you have any or other specific items, you would like to address please feel free to reach out to our Director of Human Resources at Stephanie@visitlandmark.com with your concerns.

google_reviews.author: Zukhra Ibrokhim
google_reviews.review:
EDIT 3/23 theyre also SUPER CREEPY. Today someone came and took pictures of our car and window for no reason.
A few days ago Carmela came to drop off papers and to make sure we were still the people who are are living here. And those exact same papers were mailed to us days later. Seemed like she just wanted to snoop on us for some reason. SUPER CREEPY

This company has taken over most rental properties in Bellingham so now we don't even have a choice but to rent from them if we want to live near campus. Every time you call the office they just don't answer and send you to their automated message system. When you come in to the office, the staff is rude and not professional at all. They have messed up so many things on their part with little to no accountability, and are always rude. Most people in the office don't seem to know how to properly do their job either, and like I mentioned, are extremely rude. Every single time we have come to the office we have left very frustrated with how much they lack in promptness and how much they exceed in rudeness.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Zukhra, thank you for the feedback.

google_reviews.author: allison steele
google_reviews.review:
Hard to communicate with since they work with so many properties. We have had a bunch of issues with our building particularly getting access to mail, not nearly enough parking available anywhere near the 6 floor building, and recycle and trash everywhere since they dont schedule pickup enough times per week. When I went to tell the property manager that people were getting towed by one of the neighbors they were quick to let me know that they do not have to provide parking before even hearing what I had to say. The building itself is fine (Samish Flats) but the people are frustrating

Update: the listing told us that one parking spot would be provided but the building was designed on a dead end road with not nearly enough parking, no mention of limited parking was given.
Trash and recycle remains an issue as this is a building full of college students and the garbage seems to only get picked up once a week. The bins are always overflowing and unless we remember to take stuff out the day after the trucks come the bins will have no room.
The property owner is nice, hes around occasionally and always friendly.
The maintenance takes a while to come, we have waited months for them to install a replacement piece for our drawer.
I wish the building owner had not chosen to work with this company and that they had put more forethought into where all 150 college students were going to park their cars.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Allison, Samish Flats was a new construction building and the property manager and her assistant assigned 1 parking space per unit which should have been resolved by now and if not please don't hesitate to reach out again. The trash might have been a little crazy at first because we scheduled to move multiple people into the building around the same time. The mail keys were delayed at move in as sometimes this happens with new construction, sorry for any inconvenience. Thank you for the feedback.

google_reviews.author: Mary Mountcastle
google_reviews.review:
The office staff at Landmark makes everything so clear and easy.  They are really expert about the needs of students looking for shared apartments.  In my case (looking to be added as a co-signer on a lease on a Western Washington house while I, myself, am in New Jersey), I found the folks at Landmark to be super helpful, clear and pleasant to work with.
They were willing to take the time to answer my many questions so I could understood all I needed to understand.  Landmark is top-notch with some really nice properties to choose from.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Mary, thank you for the 5 stars! This is such great feedback for our team!

google_reviews.author: AA aa
google_reviews.review: Do not rent from them if you can help it. They are slumlords. They arent anywhere near kind or considerate. They leverage your need for housing against you and thy take advantage of the demand for housing in this town. Their favorite victims are young students who have no knowledge about laws or better options. Avoid them at all costs.

ownerResponse.text: Hi AA, thank you for the feedback. If you have any other specific items, you would like to address please feel free to reach out to our Director of Human Resources at Stephanie@visitlandmark.com with your concerns.

google_reviews.author: shay doe
google_reviews.review: I'm not sure why all the bad reviews I was able to get a very nice place for a good price and there was no battle. They took my money and worked with me to make sure it was me who got the apartment. The fees are a little bit pricey but worth it for the peace off mind that nobody can come in and take it while your waiting for responses from people of paper work. Since I have moved the property manager has been easy to contact. Which is a huge deal for me. They have come right a way to fix things. And are very responsive.

ownerResponse.text: Shay, thank you for the kind review! We hope you continue to enjoy your new apartment!

google_reviews.author: Morgan G
google_reviews.review: The people I spoke to were always nice. Took quite a while to respond to maintenance requests. 2 stars because like most management companies they completely screw you on the deposit. I left my studio apartment deep cleaned and spotless and not only did they charge me $35/hr for cleaning but stated it took 5 1/2 hours to clean my completely empty 650ft studio. Quite ridiculous.

ownerResponse.text:
Hi Morgan,

We do not make any profit off the cleaning rates charged to our tenants, the cleaning invoice goes to pay the vendor who was tasked with cleaning the unit. Each of our leases clearly states cleaning rates and each tenant is provided with our cleaning guide upon moving into their rental to ensure they get the most money back from their deposits when it comes time to moving out. It also appears that we provided you with a copy of the cleaning invoice and a video to ensure complete transparency.

google_reviews.author: Izabela Ramos
google_reviews.review: Very poor customer service. Called today inquiring about a unit, and at first the woman I spoke with seemed nice and helpful. It turned out the unit was already taken which was okay, there were some other ones I had been looking at. I mostly wanted to ask about application and policy information. Suddenly when I asked a very simple question about their holding fee and what exactly it does, her attitude shifted for the worse. She refused to listen or answer my question, continually interrupted me, and was very disrespectful. What should have been an easy question and answer, ended in a disgruntled mess. Prior to this interaction, my partner and I were seriously considering renting from one of landmarks properties but we will never rent from them now. It is not hard to simply be kind. Landmark apparently does not hold this virtue. First impressions are very important and I am very disappointed in their values.

ownerResponse.text: Izabela, we are sorry to hear that happened. If you would like to contact us and give us more information, please do so and send us an email at info@visitlandmark.com. Thank you!

google_reviews.author: Josh Breshears
google_reviews.review: When I first moved to Bellingham, I lived in a different place each year- I eventually came to Tullwood apartments and stayed there for the next 4 years as it finally felt like a good fit. Then COVID hit and I left and moved onto the hotel property I managed for a much less glorious lifestyle than most seemed to imagine. Thankfully, a year and a half later I was finally able to move out, except that nowhere was available in Bellingham. On a chance, I decided to call Amy the property manager of Tullwood who, much to my happy surprise, informed me a one-bedroom had just opened up and was not even listed yet! Even better, it was the same size as other units I had been exploring but at about $200-300/month less expensive! Its a great property, all the tenants are nice and polite, lots of kids around- Amy in particular is amazing and super friendly and helpful. She goes out of her way to make everyone feel welcome while fostering a relaxed environment. The property itself doesnt have a lot of frills about it but its well maintained, and well located. The buildings are secured and locked for and added sense of comfort in addition to the gated property, and noise between units is minimal. If I ever move back to Bellingham, Tullwood is the first place Ill check out and Amy will be my first call!

google_reviews.author: Belsa Martinez
google_reviews.review: Finding a rental has been stressful.  Working with Erika at Landmark has not.  Erika has been quick to respond to all of my emails (there have been many).  She has answered all of my questions in a kind, respectful and timely manner.  The front desk receptionist and the person manning the available text line were incredibly helpful and friendly as well.  I would highly recommend Landmark for your rental needs.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Belsa, thank you for the 5 stars!

google_reviews.author: Courtney Emmons
google_reviews.review: Landmark took over my apartment building, previously managed by Apex and so far, I'm very happy with them. When something needs maintenance within my apartment, they take care of it sometimes as soon as the next day. Kimberly is also really friendly and I'm comfortable coming to her with any issues or questions. The only negative I've experienced is that my rent is going up quite a bit, but that's the harsh reality of Bellingham renting. Happy to be signing a new lease with them!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Courtney, thank you so much for the kind review! Were happy to hear that youve had a great renting experience with us. :)

google_reviews.author: Rhiannon Foister
google_reviews.review: Wanda was great! She was very friendly and was informative. Highly recommend working with her.

google_reviews.author: Noah brown
google_reviews.review: I had the pleasure of working with Irene at Landmark. She helped me find an apartment that was in my budget, and even took the extra time to talk to me about all the details. It's nice to have a property management company go out of their way for you, so I definitely recommend Landmark.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Noah, thank you for the 5 stars and the kind words about Irena!

google_reviews.author: Katy M
google_reviews.review:
Rented from Landmark for about 5 months until the apartment complex was bought by Monterra Apartments.
The process of finding a place was not ideal. They didnt tell us until our second time applying for a place that you should put a holding fee down in order to be considered, not just the actual application fee. (If you are in the process of applying, definitely do this!! It cost us the first place we applied to, which we were in love with). We felt mislead by them not telling us this on our first application.
The application process was overall very pricey with lots of different weird fees, but we paid them.
On move-in day, a man (we later found out was the maintenance man) yelled at us to move our truck out of the parking lot as we were unloading. There was no where else to park and we werent blocking anything, plus moving everything out took like an hour, tops. It was unprofessional for him to raise his voice at us like that. We saw him a couple more times after that and he was professional and nice, and did a great job fixing our dishwasher, so maybe he was just having a bad day?
We have had a few issues with management not being easy to get ahold of, but as long as youre persistent youll get an answer eventually (call instead of email, this is really the only way weve gotten a response).
There were some really good things: Our apartment was in good shape when we moved in, clean and free of damage besides normal apartment wear and tear stuff. The price of rent is reasonable for the place we have, and we could keep our cat, which is great. The parking at our building was free and we could always find a spot, even late at night.
Overall, it was not a great experience, but not the worst, so Ive given them 3 stars.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Katy, It is our goal to inform every applicant of the application process, we do provide handouts at the showings and the first page our application also details out the process. Our application fees and move in fees are the same as our competitors, which are standard for this area. Obviously we do not condone yelling at tenants by our onsite managers but we do have clear parking guidelines that we expect all tenants to follow for the safety and ease of navigation through the parking lot.

google_reviews.author: Lisa Bellevie
google_reviews.review: I was terrified to reach out to Landmark after reading all the reviews but they are one of the biggest Property Management Companies in the area and the market is so crazy right now I couldn't avoid it. I am SO GLAD I called them! They have been ABSOLUTLEY WONDERFUL in every interaction I have had with them so far! Kendra has answered all my questions promptly (and I have had a lot! lol!), she's treated me with respect, been polite and kind during every conversation we have had. Thank you Kendra for helping me find a new place to call home. I will recommend Landmark to anyone I know looking for a place.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Lisa, Thank you for the 5 star review! We are so happy to hear that Kendra was so accommodating. Kendra is very knowledgeable and has lots of experience which makes her an asset to our team here at Landmark!

google_reviews.author: Ab McDonald
google_reviews.review:
Update: 2.5 years later and still not a single problem
UPDATE: 5 months and still not a problem
Weve been renting for 3 months now and have had great help from several people from Landmark. As long as youre communicative and are persistent you will get all the assistance you need! I get fast responses, through email or phone calls, and theyre useful! A lot of these reviews sound like young people who assume their problems will be solved if they dont take any action themselves and leave it for someone else -RESPECT YOUR HOMES PEEPS, you have to take care of your space like you do a person and you usually wont have problems. Thanks Landmark, we love our home!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Abby, Thank you so much for the kind review, were so happy to hear youre enjoying your home! We truly do try our best to respond to all the emails and phone calls that come in from our tenants, but sometimes it can be difficult to respond to all requests in a timely fashion. Persistence is key, it helps keep us in check and act accordingly so we can help solve our tenants problems.

google_reviews.author: Michael Newman
google_reviews.review:
I live(d) here between September 2014 to June 2015 and in that time Landmark has made questionable calls in that time in my opinion. These are the events: 1) The first time I had to pay rent I missed the appropriate date and instead of calling me or emailing me i was left a note on my door that I was to be evicted in a few days. I paid my rent with a $150 fine but felt like I had been treated harshly. 2) When I paid my first rent they slapped on a pet fee (that was not in the lease agreement) because I had stated in a questionnaire they gave me that I wanted a pet. The deposit (which was stated in the lease) was $500 and the monthly pet charge (which was not in the lease) was around $150 a month. 3) The first time I filled a maintenance report it was about how my dishwasher didn't use water. When a maintenance worker came to fix it they told me that "the problem was simple and I might get the entire bill" which made me feel award before he left silently. 4) When I asked multiple times to get my intercom and toilet fixed it fell onto deaf ears until I started making maintenance requests daily. That got somebody to come to my apartment, look at my toilet, mess with the back, and then they left me a message telling me that it was "good enough" and if I wanted it fixed more to call them. My intercom still doesn't work. 5) There was a time when some of the parking lot spaces had to be vacated in order to update the sewer system and Landmark left letters on several people's doors which seemed arbitrarily aggressive about how certain spots had to be vacated to a different location that was made abundantly clear that we were not suppose to park or we would be towed on those days and if we were in that designated zone the day after they switch out the sewer system then we would be towed. 6) The parking. Every person I talk to that lives here has had multiple issues with parking. There is not enough of it and people (mostly Landmark) gets tow-happy with vehicles.

These have been my personal experiences with Landmark. I have also heard from trusted sources that people who have moved out get most if not all of their deposit on their apartment's taken.

google_reviews.author: Kave
google_reviews.review: Not sure what all of these complaints are about...both my roommate and I have gotten quick responses and quick fixes from this company. We appreciate the hassle-free move in and they were clear with everything we had to turn in in order to do so. They even let us move in two days early on short notice because we had to move out of our old place suddenly. Kimberly, Catharine, and whoever else Ive spoken with have been the best Help!! My girlfriend and I are as happy as can be!

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for the kind review!

google_reviews.author: Melanie Netzel
google_reviews.review:
Upon move in the apartment was decently clean, but certainly not spotless and no cleaning crew had been there for sure. I had a friend who moved in to a different unit in the same building and had to force them to get the carpets cleaned before he could bring his stuff in because the unit was so dirty. I left the apartment in much better shape than it was in when I moved in, and yet they charged me $500 to clean the place. I don't know that that $500 is going towards, but if the condition of how it was when I moved in is any indication, I don't think they're truly using it to clean the apartments. They charge for every little thing and treat you poorly in return.

I really didn't have a strong opinion either way with Landmark before moving out. I had had a few things break, and it took a few grumpy phone calls before anyone would fix anything, but it was an average apartment experience up until move out. The apartment manager was not in the office when I turned in my paperwork to move out and I never got any sort of confirmation from her that they received it. Out of a $1300 deposit, I only got $700 back. Why? Cleaning the carpet (I expected this since I had a cat and that's the only way to get cat hair completely out for the next tenant), painting over nail holes that I filled as requested ($125... really? In what world does touch up paint cost $125?), "replacement of drip pans" that were spotless when I left, and $250 for "cleaning". Cleaning what? Beats me. They wouldn't expand on any details.

Don't rent here if you expect a fair move out process or timely repairs.

google_reviews.author: northwest renovation services
google_reviews.review:
I work with Landmark Management since 2009 and can highly recommend it as a property management company. Landmark has wonderful people that will go extra mile to get problem resolved, what ever it might be.
I think that Leslie, Katharine, Carmela are doing great job especially when it comes to customer service, safety of the tenants, attention to details and just keeping properties taken care of in general. Great job and keep it this way!

ownerResponse.text: Thank you David for the 5 star review, we love having you as part of our vendor team and appreciate all you do for us here in the office! You are the BEST!

google_reviews.author: Mercedes Tackett
google_reviews.review: I have been a vendor of Landmark for years. They have been wonderful to work with. I personally work with Amy at the Tullwood Apartments. Amy is very personable and easy to work with. Of all my interactions with her she is always professional and easy to talk to. Also everyone at Tullwood apartments know her by name and always has nice thing to say about her. I wish all my accounts were as easy to work with.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Todd, we appreciate your five star review and grateful we have Amy has part of our team here at Landmark! We are happy to hear from others that have had great experiences working with her as well as renting units from her complex.

google_reviews.author: Lisa Dillon
google_reviews.review:
My experience with Landmark is based solely on my interactions with my property manager.  I can't comment on the company as whole.

Leslie Medina is a fantastic property manager.  Attentive,  professional, efficient getting work orders resolved in a timely manner.
Because of Leslie and her assistants, I've had a good experience living at my rental property.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Lisa, thank you for the 5 stars and very kind words about Leslie!

google_reviews.author: Chris Jacobs
google_reviews.review: Vanessa did a great job showing us several apartments. She was knowledgeable, professional, and very friendly. She also had a lot of information to share about the area and took a genuine interest in helping us find the right home.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Chris, thank you for the 5 stars and the amazing words about Vanessa!!!

google_reviews.author: Mark Andrushenko
google_reviews.review:
I had made an appointment with someone over the phone to look at an apartment studio. I had to coordinate with work to leave early so I can look at it during their office hours. I let them know I would call and let them know if I couldnt make it.
The day of the appointment I receive a phone call two hours before the appointment to confirm. Im able to confirm that Ill be there. They offered me to pick up the key as long as I leave collateral, I agree I can do that. The girl on the phone confirms with her supervisor, she gets the green light.
I show up on time to my appointment to learn that the studio was already taken. Apparently someone came in with a holding fee before I got there. I understand first come first serve, however, they paid the holding fee an hour before they called me to confirm my appointment. Wildly unprofessional and inconsiderate. These landlord sharks are crippling affordable housing in Whatcom County.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Mark, I did some digging and found out that there was some mistakes made on our part. The holding fee was placed at 1:15 pm that day and our showing agent called you to confirm the key check out/ showing after the fact and she didn't check to see if the unit was still available. Is there any other studio's that we have on our website that you would be interested in touring? I am also more than happy to leave some coffee gift cards at our front desk for you. Thanks.

google_reviews.author: Dylan Zumwalt
google_reviews.review: At first I thought the terrible customer service was due to the office employees incompetence/laziness, but at this point I can only conclude that they willfully ignore their tenants requests for support. If you ever have to call to resolve an issue, you usually only get one call to the front desk before they recognize your number and stop picking up. Even when they do pick up, any time you need to speak to a manager/anyone with the authority to resolve your issue, that person always happens to be out of the office (convenient for them since the issues these individuals resolve typically come at a cost to the agency). On one occasion they pulled this routine of ignoring calls and claiming the property manager was out for lunch (at 3pm? Really?) for 3 weeks when my roommate was simply trying to get a refund because we had been double-charged for a $10 electric bill. They gave me the same go-round when I was trying to resolve an issue with the end of my lease. For weeks I called the office to inquire as to whether I would be given a partial refund for my rent payment for the month of November, given that I had committed to vacate by the 20th. All i wanted was to know if I would either receive said refund, or be given until the end of November to vacate. One final note is that, at the start of my tenure with them, they conveniently forgot the addendum on the lease that I sublet, which would state that the lease expires in November, and tried to wrangle my roommate and I into a year long commitment instead of the 3-month commitment we signed up for from the sub-letter. It took an actual visit from the sub-letter with a physical copy of the addendum in hand to overturn this mistake. Horrible, unethical, slimy company that I would advise any and all prospective tenants to avoid at all costs.

ownerResponse.text: We apologize for the confusion, and we apologize for what may seem as unnecessary delays for completing tasks. Often times it takes a while to verify information such as working with Puget Sound Energy, in which the release of a tenant's account information, despite being the Property Management company for that tenant and property does not guarantee access to billing records, as that is private information. We may get a copy of the bill, but that doesn't give us access to find out whether or not you've made a payment. We did make sure to rectify this, upon receiving all the necessary information. In regards to the change of tenancy and the duplicate leases, we are always willing to send copies of your lease agreements for you to read and review, for clarification of lease end dates. Additionally, you can always come into our office if you need help going over your lease. Again, we are sorry for any confusion and that you felt that your needs were not important to us. Going forward we hope that all your experiences with property management companies exceed your expectations.

google_reviews.author: Annmarie Sheahan
google_reviews.review: Yes, the deposit and fees are pricey, but honestly, that is the case with most renting companies these days.  I am moving up to Bellingham later this month from Albuquerque, New Mexico.  I have been working with Laura and her assistant Sara and they have both been responsive and helpful and have really made the transition easier for me.  I will review again once I have lived on the property for awhile, but at the moment, I've been really happy with my experience.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Annmarie, thank you so much for the kind review! We're so happy we could help make your move to Bellingham a little easier!

google_reviews.author: Robyn Agajanian
google_reviews.review: Very unprofessional and seemed like they didn't care about your living situation at all. We had to put in a few maintenance requests and after waiting a few weeks we decided to call and had to keep calling them about it over and over until it actually got done. And not all of them were fixed. When we first moved in none of the cleaning or maintenance, that was suppose to be done and that's even written on the lease, was never done. The carpet smelled like pee, the blinds were bent and never went back down, one of the heaters was broken, and our washing machine leaked into the apartment right below us. The blinds later fell off without anyone touching them and we asked again if we could get new ones and never happened. They charged us for the installment of new blinds when we moved out. Currently waiting for a "Secondary Review of Security Deposit Refund" form that we requested because we feel we were incorrectly and unfairly charged. We'll see how long it takes for them to respond back to us. They charge you at such a high rate for cleaning and maintenance services after you move out. They charged us $200 for cleaning services. What's the point of spending hours cleaning it yourself if they're just gunna charge you out the ass to have it cleaned. They also charged us $135 for carpet cleaning, which I can somewhat understand, and they also charged us $188.32 for other maintenance repairs, which is a joke when they never get any of your maintence requests fixed when you're living there. Never again will we go back to Landmark to look for an apartment. Very poor customer service. Just finished watching the review move out video on YouTube and I hope they're not blaming us for all those rips in the carpet and all the other scratches because we moved in and they were like that. We even wrote it down on the checklist, that they probably lost. Also the heaters were already scratched and the blinds that were left on the floor next to the window was when they fell and no one came to fix them after I sent in two requests. The Maplewood apartments are really old, so we were expecting the usual wear and tear of our apartment when we first moved in, but when you write down the damages on a checklist when you first move in and then feel like you're being blamed for them is not how you should treat your customer, especially when you're trying to gain more customers or want returning customers. I've never had such a bad experience with any other property management before. Terrible company.

ownerResponse.text: Landmark did receive a total of six maintenance requests during your tenancy, including ones for a missing screen and a slow-to-fill toilet. Some requests were found to be non-issues, like a baseboard heater that made noise when warming up; the washer issue was sent to an appliance repair company. Landmark manages leasing and rent collection for that unit, however, we are not contracted to provide repair services. Three of your maintenance requests were forwarded to the building owner who self-manages repairs. We are in the process of reviewing the Secondary Review Request, received in our office on Sept. 14. If you have additional questions about the review, or damage/repairs you feel you documented on your Move In Adjustment Form, please contact our property management director, Kim H., directly at 360-738-1022. We hope to get this resolved for you shortly.

google_reviews.author: Rebeka Chadwell
google_reviews.review: Landmark Property Management is one of the worst companies I have ever rented through. Too bad I cant give a zero star review because they dont even deserve that. Since applying which took a full week and we couldnt even get ahold of anyone on the phone during that time. The unit was infested with cockroaches and the bug maintenance people came out every week and it did nothing. Maintenance calling numerous times because they forgot if they came out or not. Like what a joke. And then upon move out they took our whole security deposit. And now we owe money?! It took two maintenance guys 6.5 hours to replace some blinds, a closet door, drip pans, and a screen vent?! They said it took them an hour two replace drip pans and 2 hours to go shopping. And apparently they arent a capitalist company. Stay away from this company thats what I have to say.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Rebeka, I just wanted to answer some of the comments from your review, Our application process is about 5 to 7 business days. From your tenant page you had applied and moved into the unit during our pre-leasing season which is our busy time of year for Landmark. During pre-leasing our phones do ring nonstop and can only be answered so quickly.  From looking into your service requests we had only one request about the cockroaches and I know we would have been more than happy to come back to your unit and resolve the issue had it not been resolved the first time. To answer your concerns about your security deposit, in the Landmark lease under Deposit and Non-refundable Fee Agreement it does say "a charge will be made for the cost of restoring the Premises to its original condition for any damage incurred during this tenancy, normal wear and tear excepted." We wish you luck in your future renting experiences and thank you for your feedback.

google_reviews.author: Brendan Lay
google_reviews.review: First experience was positive, friendly and helpful staff. Everything was handled very quickly, but I was greeted by Vanessa who was very polite and professional. I would recommend simply due to the customer service which helped me through the application process and how well Vanessa treated me!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Brendan, Thank you for the 5 stars and all the kind words about Vanessa!!

google_reviews.author: Elizabeth Leibovitz
google_reviews.review: Katharine Williams was remarkable. She responded promptly to my questions and requests. She was consistently professional and communicated clearly and effectively. Though I did not have much contact with Leslie,  she too was very efficient at her job and responded in a timely manner to any issues that arose in the building. Overall, it was an exceptional experience living a McKenzie Square for over 4 years.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Elizabeth, Thank you for the 5 stars and the amazing feedback about Katharine, she truly is an asset to our team here at Landmark!

google_reviews.author: Roxanne George
google_reviews.review:
I was helped by Carmella and Vanessa. I have just recently moved to Bellingham from Washington and these ladies went above and beyond to help me find my perfect place! They are both so so lovely and patient, even when I had about a million questions. Carmella walked through every property with me and helped me hunt while Vanessa the next day showed me the unit I wanted and even helped me take measurements.
Im so grateful to have found this property management and I look forward to using them in the future.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Roxanne, thank you for the 5 stars and the kind words!

google_reviews.author: Grace Holzer
google_reviews.review: Ocean was very kind when trying to find a new place :) will definitely consider renting through Landmark in the future

google_reviews.author: Spencer Smith
google_reviews.review: Vanessa assisted me during my relocation to Bellingham, WA.  She was a good listener and communicator, punctual, very likable, and knowledgeable of properties in the area.  And if she didn't know the answer, she knew how to find it.  Also, she exceeded my expectations when she sought out additional properties meeting my search criteria.  I would recommend Vanessa as a rental property specialist.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Spencer, thank you for the 4 stars and the kind words!

google_reviews.author: Amanda Johnson
google_reviews.review: The Landmark employee I have worked with so far has been very receptive and quick to answer any and all questions. Her name is Vanessa, but from what I saw it looks like all of the Landmark personnel are just as friendly and competent. Securing a place to live is a complicated process, so having assistance that is fast and reliable is exceedingly important.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Amanda, thank you for the 5 stars and the kind words!

google_reviews.author: Nakita Most
google_reviews.review: My husband and I have truly enjoyed our experience with Landmark Real Estate Management. We have especially enjoyed working with Leslie Medina who was always available when we needed assistance. We were sad to leave Landmark upon our move because of the great customer service they provided. We would definitely go back if we found another rental with them.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for reviewing and rating our services, Nakita! We'd be happy to help you find a new home when the time comes!

google_reviews.author: Kevin Masters
google_reviews.review: Extremely helpful staff and management. Brittany is always there to help out and walked us through the whole rental process. Best management company, wont be leasing through anyone else!

google_reviews.author: Nick Stone
google_reviews.review:
Cons:
- When I first put down my deposit & paid rent, I went to the bank to cash a check and returned to the property management to deposit the money with them. The next time rent came around, they told me that one of the $100 bills was a fraud & that they sent that bill & my name to the secrete service and told me it was my problem and that I still need to pay $100. I did not consent, they had no proof, and they flat out were just handling cash in the background behind the counter loosely. Needless to say I told them I was going to take action and they credited the $100.
*Note: they have implemented online payments and have seemed to pull that together quite a bit.
- A lot of unnecessary fees

Pros:
- When I moved in, I requested that the carpet be pulled and replaced due to a previous tenant; they did right away.
- To come and fix the microwave due to inactivity; they did in a reasonable time frame.
- Management did multiple upgrades & consistent inspections to the property
- I cleaned my apartment and returned it during move out day and received 77%, I guess that is OK due to having a dog, painting the walls, & forgetting to clean the oven.

Besides the issue above and me cleaning the crap out of that place for only a 77% return, I actually didn't have the worst experience with them. But I would be leery and make sure you follow the rules to a tee because it is hard to convince any of them of your case or situation once they have made their opinion/decision.

I am not a student and I procured an apartment in McKenzie Square.

google_reviews.author: Brenda Apt
google_reviews.review:
Landmark Property Management was always helpful and easy to deal with whether it was a repair or a noisy neighbour or a parking issue. The apartment was larger than most in our community and had all the amenities I
needed. I would highly recommend this business to assist you with your housing needs.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Brenda, thank you for the 5 stars and the kind words!

google_reviews.author: Forrest West
google_reviews.review: Vanessa was extremely professional and helpful in getting our applications set up. She gave clear excate instructions for what we needed to do. She also had everything ready when my wife came into the store..We are very excited to continue working with her.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Forrest, thank you for the 5 stars!

google_reviews.author: Kristina Loop
google_reviews.review: Erika was great to work with! She is very friendly and proactive in getting things taken care of! She is a great person to work with!!! Thank you Erika!

google_reviews.author: Skywalker D
google_reviews.review:
There are a lot of opinions about Landmark out there, I will leave my review based solely on factual occurrences:

1. I moved out and moved into a new Landmark property. Well over 21 days passed and no deposit or statement of fixes was given. When I inquired after a couple months, they sent me a check for just over $10.00. I followed up with a demand letter for entire deposit citing the RCW they were blatantly attempting to violate, they refunded the full deposit within one week.

2. When moving out of our last place after buying a home, I wanted to make sure they still had the move in inspection form we signed; they legally need to have a copy on file to be able to keep some/all of a damage deposit and they also are legally required to provide a tenant one copy when asked during that tenants tenancy.

When we asked for a copy, we were told it wasnt available, it was filed away in storage off site, they had switched from paper files to digital since we moved in and they may not have it at all and theyd have to get back to us a different day, etc. After a rather large commotion and being threatened to have the cops called on us for harassment because we knew exactly what we were entitled to, they conveniently sent over the electronic pdf of the document via email within literally 21 minutes of us leaving the office. Very impressive if it was indeed a hard copy only stored offsite like they stated.

3. We had to break our lease due to buying a home and went through their break lease option, electing to pay rent until it was re-rented. They immediately listed the property for $1,500, multiple hundreds of dollars more than the $1,300 we were paying. Certainly their right, just seemed scummy.

There were some other instances of subpar property management, but these two situations told me everything I need to know about how they do business. There is a reason they are one of the worst review property management companies in Whatcom county.

google_reviews.author: Audra Day
google_reviews.review:
THE worst rental experience I've ever had.  On April 7th, they announced that they would be coming in and replacing all of our baseboard heaters.  We waited for them all day, and they didn't show up.  2 days later, there's a knock at the door, the contractor they hired to work on the apartment.  Ok, not the day you said you'd be here but sure, come on in.  I left for work and came back to brand new heaters, which were very nice and solved our heating issues.

What was not included in the notice we received was that there were going to be large holes in the walls around the heaters, since the new ones were so much smaller.

There are heaters in every room of the house.

I thought it was weird, and it's a little jarring to walk into your home and see that much damage without warning.  So I waited a couple of weeks thinking maybe they were busy, there are 10-20 units in my complex, it probably takes time.  I tried to be very understanding of things and I've worked in a hotel under construction before, I understand that sometimes things get delayed and it sucks and I was patient.

After a month went by and I heard nothing, I called them and asked about the repairs.  The assistant manager of this property, who was and is very nice, and has continued to be kind and sound so understanding, has been the only one who would talk to me when I called.

But as nice and understanding as she sounds, she still does not call me back with more details like she continues to say she will, she does not leave any messages, every time I call, I get told that they're working on it and it's the contractor's fault.

Just gonna cut in here to apologize for the long review, but I just want to prepare you for what to expect should you decide to move into one of their properties.  Wish I had known before I renewed my lease with them.

Finally, in JUNE, the contractor shows up.....but he only fixes half of the holes in the house.  My roommate was asleep in her room at the time, but the contractor told me not to worry about waking her up, since he had to come back one more time anyway, to put in the baseboards where parts of those holes still remain in every single room.

We are now to the point where I call them every week or two, and have the same lovely conversation with the same nice sounding lady, who tells me every time how frustrating it is for them as well.

And now we are a week away from AUGUST.  For those of you not keeping track, it's now been 4 months of foot-long holes staring at us while we sleep, cook, eat, use the bathroom, watch TV, and when we go to leave.  It's the first thing you notice when you walk in the door, and the last thing you see on your way out.

Oh, we've had a bunch of fun with all those carpenter ants and spiders and earwigs coming into the house because of this issue.  It's just been a BLAST.  Thanks for raising our rent in June as well!  I really think those improvements you made are worth paying you an extra $25/month.

I work in a job where I see about 50 new people every day and am encouraged to have conversations with them while they wait.  I come into contact with people new to the area and looking for advice on where to live almost daily.

I'll make sure to pass this story along to all of those people, just to make sure we don't have any more "frustrating experiences."

google_reviews.author: Sally Robertson
google_reviews.review: Absolutely DO NOT recommend. If you want to be ignored, lied to and passed from person to person (all who do not know what they are saying) then this is the management for you! Everyone I spoke with told me something different. They take DAYS- with constant emailing, texting, calling, leaving messages to even reply and most of the time didnt answer my questions and instead would give me irrelevant information. Do your research, there is a lot about them out there, most of it awful as it should be. They are just after money- fee after fee and they will only try to problem solve when you want your money back (even though said solutions are already things I said wouldn't work). Overall an awful experience that dragged on for weeks just to end up with me finding another place and getting approved with all the help I need within 3 days of my application.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Sally, thank you for the feedback. If you have any specific items, you would like to address please feel free to reach out to our Director of Human Resources at Stephanie@visitlandmark.com with your concerns.

google_reviews.author: Laura Acidera
google_reviews.review: I have lived on Landmark Property, Tullwood Apartments, for over 3 years now. They're online portal makes paying rent and making maintenance request really easy and convenient. They're very responsive and deal with all requests within 24 hours (usually sooner!). The onsite property manager, Amy, is very friendly and professional. The property is well maintained and clean.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Laura, this is such an awesome five star review! Thank you! We are so happy that you have enjoyed living at Tullwood and working with Amy!

google_reviews.author: Niko W.
google_reviews.review:
Landmark real estate management Bellingham WA is literally the most unprofessional, rude, and unorganized company I have ever had the displeasure of dealing with.

I made several attempts (emails&phone calls) to contact Landmark regarding to near future rental questions, and no one ever contacted me back, and when I finally reached a rude guy on the phone,
he sounded annoyed and could not wait to hand up on me.

I have decided that a business that treat potential customers in such a way, is not worth my time. And after seeing so much of their Negative reviews, I feel fortunate to pull myself out before it's too late.

google_reviews.author: Robert Pratt (RPiii)
google_reviews.review: Landmark is fantastic. Ive had a lot of terrible landlords & management companies - and from Day ONE, we were already more than a number. They respond, they actually talk to you...explain things. they are an incredibly professional business and Id choose them again in an instant. Thank you so much!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Robert, Thank you for the 5 stars and the kind words!

google_reviews.author: greg sage
google_reviews.review: Most incompetent, unprofessional company I have ever worked with. They managed 3 of my properties poorly. I moved them to another vender as soon as the contracts expired. The managers, service people and accounting departments never communicate. Problems are never fully resolved and all you ever get is uninformed lip service. All three of my tenants complained about the service they "didn't receive" and their treatment. They paid venders for services that weren't provided. in 2106, I was on my third manager by June. One only lasted 2 months and left. Good luck with this one.

google_reviews.author: Damon Peterson
google_reviews.review:
Unethical people currently practicing price gouging during the housing crisis.  Imagine what they would do if you found yourself in a binding contract with them.

Renters, hold these people accountable.  Give everyone that gouges terrible reviews, flag posts on CL that are ridiculous.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Damon, thank you for the feedback. If you have any other specific items, you would like to address please feel free to reach out to our Director of Human Resources at Stephanie@visitlandmark.com with your concerns.

google_reviews.author: Deena Resnick
google_reviews.review: CALL BEFORE APPLYING to check availability!!!! They leave taken units up after someone has put a holding fee down and let people apply for them, then send an email saying its unavailable but you can transfer your application to another listing (they will refuse to refund it even if the unit was not available at the time you applied even though they still had it listed). This can be good depending on if there are lots of  listings that appeal to you, however it seems to be a ploy to make people feel invested in Landmark and to then try to force themselves to find a place to apply to with Landmark. I applied to two unrelated units at 6-7pm, and 8:48 am got emails saying that both units had had holding fees placed on them.  I asked to know the exact time for the holding fee because one of the units had been listed for months untouched, so I found the timing a little suspicious that they had been taken overnight just like that. Additionally, they post new units usually when they are closed so you CAN'T call. You have to risk losing the unit by waiting till they open to ask about availability, or risk the wasted fee; they know what you will choose and are literally banking on it. They never got back to me so I can only assume that the listing were taken loooong before I ever applied. They even updated the availability date of on of the units to "Available Now" after they informed me it had been taken. EDIT: Further proof of this suspicion was confirmed when I saw the same taken apartment newly listed on FB marketplace 3 days after a I was informed a holding fee had been placed on it and they had stopped accepting applications on it. (**Enter Landmark's canned response below).

ownerResponse.text: Hi Deena, thank you for this thorough feedback! I understand your frustration with the process and finding a rental can be difficult as all companies have different policies in place but feel free to call our office anytime with any questions at 360-738-1022. Wish you luck in your future search!

google_reviews.author: Jillian Scerreno
google_reviews.review:
I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. We applied for an apartment over a month ago and they refused to process our applications without the holding fee of $1100. They kept asking for more stuff and still blaming us after we sent it that we never got it. We kept getting told it would be "just another week" and realized that we had enough. We went in to demand our money back, because they never even processed the applications, and they refused our money back. In my eyes, they stole $1100 from two college students. They are crooks and we basically feel robbed.

Update: The owners have replied and it has not given me the option to reply back. We were NEVER told we were approved and we have emails to back up we have given you everything you needed and you kept asking for the same information over and over. We didn't just "decide" to leave. We were told they were working on our application, and we NEVER were told that we were approved.

ownerResponse.text:
Hi Jillian,

I want to start off by apologizing for a more than an unpleasant experience with us. Unfortunately applications do take a lot longer to process during our pre-leasing season. It looks like you were in fact approved, which is why we kept requesting more paperwork. But it looks like you decided you were no longer interested in the unit and pulled out of the rental process. The $1100 holding fee (deposit) is non-refundable according to our policy, which all applicants are made aware of prior to beginning the application process.

google_reviews.author: Simon V.D.
google_reviews.review: All around amazing service and quality shout out to Haelley!

google_reviews.author: Teagan
google_reviews.review: I talked with a person here about making sure I got the correct amount of money back with my deposit and they were incredibly condescending. I have called before and talked with people who were nice and patient. Sometimes I do admit I cant explain things well, but the person I talked to did not want to give me the time of day and told me to go read my ledger. I dont write reviews but holy moly, this was one of the worst calling experiences Ive had and I work customer service myself.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Leah, thank you for the feedback. Looks like your security deposit did get mailed out and hopefully that helps answer any questions you might have had. Please don't hesitate to reach out again if you do have questions or send an email to info@visitlandmark.com

google_reviews.author: Mitchell Walker
google_reviews.review: Landmark is literally the worst real estate place I have ever dealt with. First off their office is so unorganized that if you have any sort of paperwork that the needs to be taken care of it takes them days to process through it all. Secondly, the place that we currently live has needed so many maintenance issues updated on it that were supposed to be completed before we moved into the place. We've had our lease for about 5 months now and they still have yet to complete them all. On top of that there were minor issues that were submitted as maintenance requests, and when confronting them over several weeks later they denied ever receiving any requests. When asks when they would be able to send someone out they said that they had no idea and couldn't even give a time frame. I told them that this was unacceptable and we've been waiting for weeks to have several minor issues resolved (this would take an hour out of any maintenance persons day if even that) they got extremely defensive and then started being the most disrespectful to me for simply asking for a date to schedule a maintenance appointment. As someone who has worked retail for several years and seen a lot of bad customer experiences, this takes the cake as the worst customer experience ever. I will never rent from them again, and I would rate them 0 stars if that were an option.

google_reviews.author: Noelle Abshire
google_reviews.review: I'm giving landmark and specifically Laura and her assistant Sara-Lyn 5 stars because they have been nothing but absolutely amazing. From the moment I moved in they have been easy to get ahold of, accommodating to my needs as a new tenant and overall extremely friendly and understanding. I hope to remain a tenant with them for as long as possible.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for reviewing and rating our services, Noelle!

google_reviews.author: Lisa Apsay
google_reviews.review:
I lived at McKenzie Square for 3.5 years and moved out early this year.  I didn't hear much from them in the first couple of years, which was fine.  I'm not quite sure what happened after that second year, but I began receiving invoices for past due rent for multiple months, even though I had never been late.  Even though I emailed my property manager and she corrected the error, it happened at least 2 other times.  Landmark would also go through McKenzie Square posting notices to enter units with less than a days notice.

These things were extremely annoying, however, the thing that put me over the edge was that one night SOMEONE TRIED TO BREAK INTO MY UNIT WHILE I WAS HOME AND I HAD TO CALL THE POLICE.  It turned out that the person was another McKenzie resident, who was intoxicated from alcohol and prescription medication and genuinely thought my unit was hers.  I didn't feel safe living near a person with those types of tendencies and asked my property manager to take action.  She didn't.

Landmark is uncaring and unresponsive to the needs of their tenants.  I highly advise a potential renter with Landmark to proceed with caution.

google_reviews.author: Rochell Daniels
google_reviews.review:
Please find, review, and listen to the other reviews out there too. I first rented from this group starting in 9/2012 and viewed an apartment that was trashed. Really trash all over the floor, dirty stinky carpets, broken door handle, nasty kitchen. Now it was still occupied so I had to give credit for the mess to the current tenants. The leasing agent also told me that they were going to have to pull up all the carpet and even replace a missing match in the linoleum and had me view another apartment that was not trashed but would not be available.

The location was good, very close to the college and they promised everything would be better when I moved in; they had 2 months to get it redone! When I showed up to move in most of the stuff that had been there was gone but there was still trash, the carpets had not been cleaned let alone replaced like the promised and turned my shoes and feet black when I made the mistake of walking on them. The flooring was still missing in some places. There was broken glass in the garbage disposal and mold in the fridge. Everything that could be covered in dirt and mildew was.

I went straight over to the leasing office where I spent time being told the carpets had been cleaned, the manager was sure they had been because the cleaning company sent a bill, though now he couldnt find it. finally he sent over a cleaning person and when she got there she realized how bad it was and called two other cleaners to come help her. They still could not get it done that day and I had to delay moving in. They promised to still replace the carpets and they have not. they also would not let me out of the lease, though I could find someone to take it over and forfeit my $1,700 in deposits and rent I had already paid.

Its just been worse since then. If you do decide to rent from them still after all the reviews dont ever need maintenance done. Days after moving in I noticed the toilet was leaking. I thought Id let them know that something else had been missed. It can cause damage after all. The maintenance person came out and took apart the whole toilet, rebuilt it. he said he replaced some rings and washers and then said the reason it had been leaking was because there was too much weight being placed on it. ok, so I rest a roll of toilet paper on the tank but come on how much can that weigh? What  a nice way to blame the new tenants and call us fat. Which I dont think we are, me and my husband weight about 190 and 185. I dont think that should break a toilet in a week. And they charged me $70 for the privilege of being insulted.

google_reviews.author: Calico Cat
google_reviews.review:
Had a 6 Month Lease from them. During the lease, they answered any questions, helped clarify any financial hiccups, and were overall attentive and courteous. Cleaned my apartment spick and span when I moved out, and received nearly the full deposit. (I think most places keep some for carpet cleaning). I am very satisfied with them and would recommend.

Also, I am a student, and they worked well with me and my roommate at the time, neither of us had a co-signer. I know a lot of people out there aren't lucky enough to have a scenario where a co-signer is possible, so if you can show proof of financial aid and such,this might be a good place to look for housing.

google_reviews.author: Michael Becker
google_reviews.review:
We never even got to the rental stage with Landmark before we figured they were not worth the hassle.  My wife set up a viewing of a property at a time that worked with our schedules.  She left work early to come see it, and they called ten minutes before the scheduled showing to cancel due to "emergency maintenance".  We had to call the office to set up a new time and found out that the current tenant had trashed the place, but the agent responsible for showing the place had known in advance.  We were frustrated, but understood and set up a new time after the maintenance.
Just the other day we called to confirm the time with Landmark and were told that someone had put a hold deposit on the place sight unseen, therefor we were not going to be show the property we had been waiting on for two+ weeks.  At this point, we have just decided that a business that treat potential customers in such a way,is not worth out time.

google_reviews.author: Kyle McSomething
google_reviews.review: By far the worst customer service I've ever had, and I've travelled to countries that don't even speak English. When I read the other reviews I was convinced that some of the bad reviews were exaggerated. However I spoke with 4 different receptionists, all of which were extremely unprofessional. They didn't secure my hold despite having all the requirements met, and when they rented my unit to someone else they didn't call me back despite having my 900$ check, since it was shipped overnight. Long story short: Landmark truely earns every bad review, and I can only look at my bad experience as a blessing in disguise, as I don't have to deal with Landmark. Instead I deal with a real agency with employees that can actually conduct themselves professionally and are helpful. Thank God for Windermere and Apex management.

ownerResponse.text: Please accept our apologies, Kyle. Our team works hard every day to streamline the rental process for tenants and the wide-range of property owners/landlords we serve. If there is one thing, in particular, that would have made your experience better, can you please share that suggestion with our property management director, Kim, at kim@visitlandmark.com.

google_reviews.author: Abby Jay
google_reviews.review:
*UPDATE* Don't let these people scam you, you can get your application fee back through your bank. I was able to refund my process today with the help of my bank.

I submitted an application and paid for it since I couldn't get a hold of anyone thinking if I paid them and they had my information surely THEY would contact me -- nope. Since paying them for virtually nothing and filling out an application I have YET to be contacted in anyway. I have emailed, I have called and still they took my money and have yet to contact me. Interesting business, I will have to call my bank and dispute the charge apparently

ownerResponse.text: Hi Abby, please let us know what we can improve on in the future. Thanks,

google_reviews.author: Chris Casquilho
google_reviews.review: Rented our property sight unseen from out of town. Had a friend stop over to give it the smell test. Landmark was very helpful and timely getting us through the paperwork even though we were in a rush. When we moved in, the carpet needed a cleaning. We called Landmark and they sent someone over right away (we weren't charged for the cleaning). Later, the upstairs neighbors exhibited a habit of being rowdy and noisy at all hours, and Landmark courteously and promptly communicated with them and got them to stop. Landmark has been great responding to maintenance requests, and their maintenance people and employees have been great. We've been here over a year.

google_reviews.author: Sheila Alamo
google_reviews.review:
I have been living at Tullwood apartments for over 3 years and I can honestly say it is one of my best experiences in apartment living.  My property manager is Amy and she is very professional, helpful, kind,
she is always available if you need her.  Our maintenance person is Azael, he is a hard worker and very personable as well.  I would highly recommend Tullwood apartments.

ownerResponse.text: HI Sheila, thank you for the 5 star review. This was a really nice review!

google_reviews.author: Luther Kreutzkamp
google_reviews.review: Terrible realty agency, expect to be told different things by different staff members. Not the fault of the front desk folks, they're good people, superintendent at the apartment I was staying at told me that there would be money coming back to me from my security deposit, then turned around and took the entire security deposit and charged me for 200$ of cleaning after I left the place scrubbed and cleaned. If you rent here, expect to be hassled at every step. Tullwood Apartments in particular are a very poorly-run community. Gave them an extra star because the previous property manager, Rex Navarro, was very good, but he has gone to greener pastures and the person who they hired to replace him is incompetent.

google_reviews.author: Daniel
google_reviews.review: Absolutely horrendous, unethical, and self-serving. Their service is the lowest of the low; for weeks I tried to reach their office by phone to resolve a simple matter and they actively avoided my calls. In the rare occasions they answered the phone, by accident I presume, they would tell me anyone who could help was out of the office. Eventually I had enough and I drove to their office to meet the manager in person, and I was told the manager was out to lunch at 3PM: I couldn't believe it. They tried to weasel my roommate and I into a year long lease instead of the 3 month lease we originally signed up for. Only after we got in contact with the sub-letter did we avoid this scheme. Even after our lease ended our woes continued as they failed to mail us the security deposit within 21 days of the lease ending, which meant we're entitled to the entire security deposit under Washington state law.
