They attempted to sneak their way past this by sending us a partial deposit, but only after threatening to sue them did they finally comply. If you have the misfortune of dealing with these snakes, then you better stay on your toes.

ownerResponse.text: Daniel, We are sorry for any confusion and that you felt that your needs were not important to us. The move out date and when the keys were returned is where the dates became the question/issue. Also, the original statement/deposit was an estimate  and our records indicate this has been revised and the additional funds had been returned to you and your roommate. Going forward we hope that all your experiences with property management companies exceed your expectations.

google_reviews.author: Kathryn Cullum
google_reviews.review: We have had nothing but positive experiences with Landmark Management. When our sons' apartment needed major repairs due to construction issues, they kept us informed on options and status every step of the way. Friendly staff and fair compensation for the inconvenience.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Kathryn, Such kinds words with great feedback and thank you for the five stars!

google_reviews.author: Jessica Hill
google_reviews.review: Delaney has been amazing with responding to my emails in a prompt and timely fashion. Moving is stressful enough and knowing my questions will be answered quickly makes all the difference. I appreciated her taking the time and making the effort. She is an asset to the Landmark team for sure!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Jessica, thank you for the 5 stars and the kind feedback!

google_reviews.author: Aly Horry
google_reviews.review: Living in a rental property managed by Landmark has been a headache for almost 2 years- and we only rented with them for one!! It started when we had to sign a lease 6 months prior to moving in. They hiked the rent up by $100 in between paying the holding fee and signing the lease, they did not take care of the water bill prior to our move-in so we were constantly hours away from having our water shut off, and no one responds to emails/voicemails. Getting repairs done was a nightmare- I had to threaten legal action just to get running water and lights on in the house. We received erroneous bills in the mail which they would say were 'taken care of,' only to receive another bill plus late fee later. They are extremely unscrupulous about returning deposits. Legally they have 14 days to return your deposit so they send a letter stating they are holding your deposit for "estimated" charges. They claim you'll get it back once they receive receipts from their vendors. Good luck! You have to continuously call and email to get any response. I finally consulted a lawyer and I can't wait to be done with them.

google_reviews.author: Garrett N
google_reviews.review: Landmark is one of the worst property management companies I have ever had the displeasure of working with. Everything from the state of the apartments, to the way that management fixes issues is flawed. For anyone trying rent from them, look elsewhere first. Unfortunately they are one of the only places to rent from in Bellingham.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Garrett, we appreciate the feedback.

google_reviews.author: Paula
google_reviews.review: In general I am satisfied with my interactions with the management of my apartment complex. Despite some unresolved issues like the fob not working on the back door.

ownerResponse.text:
Hi Paula, 
We are sorry to hear that about your fob. Please reach out to your property manager so we can resolve this and get you a fob that works for both doors.
Thank you!

google_reviews.author: Jamie Winters
google_reviews.review: Needed a place in the middle of this pandemic and they made every effort possible to help us move in safely and quickly. The manager Amy helped us get moved in and made us feel like part of the community. Never had such a welcoming and caring apartment manager!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Jay, We are so happy to hear Amy was able to help you so quickly. She really does give that extra personal touch with her property management style. We are so lucky to have her on the Landmark team!

google_reviews.author: Josh Moore
google_reviews.review: Wow! I've never been so insulted in my life. I pay my rent every month on time and I'm treated like a second rate citizen. My refrigerator hasn't worked in over a week. I made several attempts to contact the staff at Landmark and no one ever contacted me back about repairing my fridge. I left two emails, voice mails and even went into the office on two separate occasions, still no one contacted me to tell me if and when someone would be over to fix my fridge. Then, low and behold, four days later, a repair service calls me at 8 am to ask if they could come over and look at it that day. Sure, let me take a half day off of work and miss out on pay because no one could call me to schedule a time. Since having a working fridge is pretty big deal I had to leave work early so that I could meet the repair man since he didn't have a key to my apartment. Then, after wasting half of my day the repair man tells me he'll have to order the part and it will be next week before my fridge is fixed. Unfortunately I can't go without a fridge that long. I have a young son that needs to have milk for his breakfast as well as other drinks, snacks, food, ect. So I called Landmark once again to find out what they were going to do to help me until my fridge was fixed. The answer I got was, "I don't know." Not the answer I was looking for. In addition to this the person who answered the phone, James, was very rude, but not as rude as the person I contacted next, my property manager, Heather Helford. All she did was make excuses as to why it took so long for a repair man to come out and look at my fridge. I don't want your excuses, I just want good customer service. Lets get one thing straight, if it wasn't for people like me paying rent, then you wouldn't have a job Heather. On the same note, if you're so frustrated with your job that you treat your customers like crap then perhaps it's time to find a new line of work as customer service is not your strong suit. Call me crazy, but I would think that you would want to make sure your tenants are happy so they continue renting from your company. I've lived here for four years. And in those four years I've always paid my rent on time, if not early and when something breaks down I don't think I should be verbally abused over the phone.

google_reviews.author: Dave Mann
google_reviews.review:
Yet another cliche ripping of a landlord company... It was over, I've been out of there for almost two months. I received my deposit back, it was done. And now I get another letter from Landmark saying I owe money yet again, because they mistakenly refunded my deposit without correctly adding up the charges.

Now they are threatening to send my "account" to collections over.....$14.14. That's it. An amount for which they are at fault for not adding properly the first time. When I called, the receptionist refused to let me speak to anyone to try to remedy the situation and until finally sending me to someone's voicemail that will never call me back.

I couldn't care less about $14, that's not the point. I get it's a form letter, but come on. At some point someone would think about things from a customer service perspective.

ownerResponse.text: Hello, Dave. Please contact me directly; I'd be happy to try and help. Kim (kim@visitlandmark.com)

google_reviews.author: Josh Moore
google_reviews.review: So here I am again venting my frustrations on Google review since calling Landmark never seems to get any results. I've been living in the same apartment for over five years now and every year they've raised my rent $20 Without ever making any improvements or even finishing projects that needed to be fixed. I literally have black mold growing on my walls and mushrooms sprouting up near my sliding glass door. Yet I've stilled paid my rent on time without fail, but recently I found out about something that truly made me sick to my stomach. Apparently I'm paying more rent than any other tenant in my apartment building. I was speaking with one of my neighbors yesterday and she said she got here new lease and they only raised her rent $5? What the hell? She was paying the exact same amount I was paying last year $640 and they only raised hers $5? Why am I paying $660 and shes paying $645. I then decided to speak to other residents in my complex and found out that people who have been living there longer than me are also paying less rent because when they received their lease they went in and complained and kept it from being raised. Well, here is me complaining and telling you that this isn't right!

google_reviews.author: Taylor Heston
google_reviews.review: Our property was acquired by Landmark midway through our lease. The apartment was reasonably priced for such a small space and when our lease ends they are jacking it up past $1000. Mark, their "handyman' is exceptionally rude. Out of the other property companies in town, I would recommend going to any other one.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Taylor, I want to start off by apologizing for an unpleasant experience with us. Would you mind contacting our Director of Property Management, Kim (kim@visitlandmark.com) to discuss any issues youve had so that we can help resolve them? Thank you.

google_reviews.author: George Hartdegen IV
google_reviews.review: Great company when you Actually Communicate with them!

google_reviews.author: Justin Riddle
google_reviews.review:
Absolutely terrible company, gave us under 12 hour notice bfore immediate eviction, all over a single room.  Had the money they knew I had had it but nope its going to someone I don't know.  I'm sure sure she's perfectly nice, but no time for a credit or background checks.  I will sleep in my truck before going back to them.

Them promised us until the end of September, nope.  I've sent 11 maintenance requests not a single response.  Not even we are busy this week, we can schedule you next next.  So now I'm in a neighborhood that dont belong for another year.

Best part we did not a single thing wrong.

May your deeds come back on you 10 fold

You lie through your you teeth

ownerResponse.text: Landmark Property Management follows state law, which requires a 20-day notice to terminate tenancy.  The notice was mailed to everyone on the lease and posted on the door of your unit. Prior to that, we had several meetings with individuals in this unit in an attempt to resolve issues. In the end, the property owner decided that terminating tenancy was necessary. If you'd like to discuss this matter in person, Justin, please feel free to schedule an appointment with our director of property management, Kim. 360-738-1022, extension 106.

google_reviews.author: Joseph Bergin
google_reviews.review: Literally slumlords, took over the lease I had from a private landlord, proceeded to try to get us to pay an extra month's rent, TWICE! If you want to find a better landlord go commit a bank robbery, the state penitentiary will treat you with more respect

ownerResponse.text: Hi Joseph, thank you for the feedback. If you have any other specific items, you would like to address please feel free to reach out to our Director of Human Resources at Stephanie@visitlandmark.com with your concerns.

google_reviews.author: starry darling
google_reviews.review: This is the worst service I've ever encountered in my time looking for apartments. Numerous times I'd tried to contact them for information on properties only to find out all of them had been rented and the website had not updated listings. When my friend and I finally found one and got into contact about making an application, we were told they needed a physical check. No problem, but neither of us live close to Bellingham (I live about an hour away and she lives in China), so I needed a few days to drive the check up because I have work and limited access to transportation. During this whole time, we'd been in close contact with James about the listing. I checked a day or so later and the listing had been taken down, contacted James and he told me it had been rented to someone else who had "pulled the trigger a little bit more quickly" for the deposit. I'm only glad I hadn't mailed the check like he'd told me I could. Not to mention he never had the courtesy to tell us that they'd already rented it out before I gave him the money. This is the final straw and I will not be doing business with this company or recommending it to anyone else. I hope James reads this.

google_reviews.author: Todd N
google_reviews.review: They did an awesome job, especially Melissa, helping me through the application process. Very prompt and professional. I can't say enough good things about Melissa and the job she did helping me through the application. I am looking forward to renting from them

ownerResponse.text: Hi Todd, thank you for the 5 stars and the kind words!

google_reviews.author: Daylund Prior
google_reviews.review: I had Vanessa help me out today and she was completely amazing. I was very confused on what I needed to do and she helped me understand what steps I had to complete in order to start the process to get an apartment. She helped me so much and overall I had a great experience.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Daylund, thank you for the 5 stars!

google_reviews.author: Frances Jose
google_reviews.review: I moved into a Landmark house with 3 other girls. We honestly have no idea how people lived in the house before us. It was so gross and unlivable that it seemed like it was a meth lab or drug house before we moved in. Obviously no one had came to check on the house and cleaned it up between the time the last people moved out and we moved in. When we picked up the keys to the house we signed a form that said there were only minor damages to the house... LOL. First of all, there was literally trash everywhere in the house and in the backyard. The basement was completely flooded when we moved in. The floors literally had feces and gum and other gross stuff on it and we have no idea how they would get there. There are nails coming out of some of the floors. The house smelled so bad the first day we moved in it nearly made us puke and we spent our own time and money having to clean it ourselves. The house obviously has not been well maintained at all because all of the paint is cracked, floors are creaking and when we scrubbed them over and over (probably more than 10 times) it would come up black every time, the washing machine, dryer, and dishwasher are ancient and look like they belong in a museum, we dont have a garbage disposal and pretty much all of our plumbing is clogged, a lot of the windows dont work, our front door lock looks like the most unsafe door lock Ive ever seen, and all of the outlets are 2 prong which is not safe because they are not grounded. Weve taken pictures and emailed them and theyve been quick to respond but have only really cleaned the basement and replaced our washing machine and dryer. I honestly dont expect the company to fix any of our other issues being that theyve never taken care of the house before us. Its a shame because it is such a beautiful and spacious house and it has just been neglected. PLEASE DO YOUR JOB TAKE CARE OF YOUR PROPERTIES. YOU SHOULD NOT LET A HOUSE GET INTO THIS CONDITION.

ownerResponse.text:
Frances, we want to apologize again for the condition you and your roommates received the home in. No one should every have to come home to something like that. When our team went in to do the MI inspection the Friday prior to your move in, they did discover the basement had flooded. Our records show that this was due to the HWT having burst, spewing water in the basement.

There was also a broken window in the basement that unfortunately we were not made aware of from the prior tenant. We did have the basement cleaned out and all the water from the flooding removed (there must have been an animal that got in). That being said, Frances, please if there are any other issues that occur to the home, contact our team right away. You can personally contact our Director of Property Management, Kim (kim@visitlandmark.com) to discuss any issues so that we can get the appropriate people out to your home to fix those problems right away.

google_reviews.author: Oakley Melville
google_reviews.review: Last year, I got sent a form that asked if I wanted to renew.  I sent it back with a yes, and later I changed my mind.  I went into the office to ask them about how to get off of the lease, and they told me they hadn't received the form and that I was good to go and didn't need to worry about it.  More than a month later, I talked to my landlord, and luckily mentioned that I wasn't renewing the lease to have her tell me that, yes I was and that she had the form right there.  I lodged a complaint with Landmark and my landlord, but didn't receive any sort of compensation or even an apology.  I had to go through the whole lease takeover process (with extra fees involved of course) with a roommate I found myself.  Obviously, I would have had to do this regardless, but it would have been nice to know a lot sooner, and I am still bitter that they were so misleading and hard to work with in general.  There are also so many vague unexplained fees.

google_reviews.author: Latacha Johnson
google_reviews.review: Long time renter thru these guys & havent had issues until now. Very disappointed in the customer service they give.. listen to everyone else when they tell you NOT to rent from them; I wish I had. They just want to take your money bottom line. No compassion like many are saying. Rude rude rude. Id give zero stars if I could. Would recommend taking your business to people who CARE & are KIND. KIND Treatment of your tenants DOES MATTER!!!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Latacha, Im sorry to hear you had an unpleasant experience with us. We care deeply about our tenants and we try to do everything in our power to insure they all have a great renting experience with us. It looks like we completed an annual inspection with you on 4/9/19 and issued a Work Order to have new locks installed (at no charge to you). We try our best to be understanding and accommodating to all our tenants and any issues that arise while renting with us, we only hope that our tenants can be understanding and patient with us in return.

google_reviews.author: jennifer morgan
google_reviews.review:
Vanessa was extremely supportive and patient with me and thoroughly answered all my questions! I am buying a house and needed guidance on how to complete a   lease take (change of tenancy)

I am so grateful for her help today!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Jennifer, thank you for the 5 stars!

google_reviews.author: Tengasha Gibeau
google_reviews.review: Rented from them. They lost my lease several times, and my lease extention after we paid in advance and called to kick us out. Also "lost" the damages paperwork from when we moved in and tried to charge us for the previous tenants damage to the apartment when we moved out. The apartment had not been cleaned when we moved in and we had to rent a professional carpet steemer 3 times to get the carpets cleaned not to mention it was infested with fees and then we were charged a fee when we moved out so the could professionally clean it. If you rent from them get a copy of all the paperwork. Log all your interactions including paying rent and stand up for yourself when they try to screw you.

ownerResponse.text: Our apologies, Tengasha. Please know that Landmark contracts with a carpet cleaning company and they clean carpets each time a home is vacated -- at the end of a lease -- as part of our tenant changeover process. One exception is in lease takeover situations when individuals are assuming a lease from someone else. Carpet cleaning and walk through inspections are not done at that time, those tasks are done at the end of the assumed lease. With regards to fleas in the unit, at the end of each lease (when tenants move out) our property managers check for pest issues during their walkthrough. The carpet cleaning company also reports any they find. If fleas are found, we send in a certified pest company to take care of the issue. If a tenant moves into a unit and finds there are pests of any kind, they should report that to us right away.

google_reviews.author: Johanna Yager
google_reviews.review: Easy to book a viewing, good communication and quick to answer any questions that came up on my rental search:) thank you!

google_reviews.author: Howard Siegel
google_reviews.review: I moved to Bellingham in 2013 and found a wonderful apartment in Fairhaven with a beautiful view and location.  The folks at Landmark could not have been more accommodating and always there with any issues and maintenance problems. They are always working on the building and making it a safer place to live.  Thank you !

ownerResponse.text: Hi Howard, thank you for the 5 stars and the amazing words about our team here at Landmark!

google_reviews.author: Kate Higman
google_reviews.review: I have been waiting to write this review for years, because they're the kind of company that would see this online and find some way to screw me over for it. This company is so awful that the owner of the condo I rent dropped them as his property management company this month because he couldn't take it anymore. They never call or email back, especially when it's regarding money that they STEAL from you. We paid our rent online using their new online payment system and it charged us a $75 late fee when it WASN'T LATE, and they NEVER paid us the money back. They kept going on about how the accounting team was "working on it", which is a flat out lie. They do everything they possibly can to screw you out of your security deposit, so unless you plan on spending multiple days cleaning every nook and cranny of your place you can kiss that money goodbye. The people who work there are the rudest and most incompetent people I have ever had the displeasure of meeting, and the company just seems incredibly disorganized and unprofessional in general. Most property management companies around here are bad, but this one is BY FAR the worst. DO NOT RENT FROM THEM.

google_reviews.author: Keith Harmon
google_reviews.review:
They want an additional $100 rent / month for each tenant without a bedroom. For instance, if you have a married couple and two children, for a three bedroom apartment, they will expect an extra $100 rent / month, despite each child getting their own room and the married couple sharing a bedroom.

They were non-negotiable over the phone, regarding this fee, even when we indicated we were not college students, but rather, a married couple with one child seeking a two-bedroom apartment. They stated that since there would be three tenants and it was a two bedroom apartment, we would have to pay an extra $100 rent / month, regardless of the fact that my wife and I would be sharing a room. We had friends (a married couple with two children) who had an identical experience to ours, indicating that this is a consistent practice for Landmark.

This practice seems like an instance of housing discrimination based on familial status, and is rather predatory in an already difficult housing market.

Perhaps if Landmark Real Estate invested as much time tending to their rental management policies as they do on Google, submitting counter reviews, they might have a better reputation within the community.

ownerResponse.text:
Hello, Keith. This fee is managed on a case-by-case basis when the number of occupants exceeds the number of bedrooms. It covers additional utility expenses and wear and tear on the rental home; it is typically only applied in  student housing situations -- think two bedroom apartment with four students sharing the two bedrooms.

We don't see your name on file as an applicant so perhaps you started the rental process online, bumped into this fee and didn't complete it. Sorry if that was the case! Regardless, please give us a call to chat about your rental home needs and we can point you toward rental situations that would not have this additional fee.

google_reviews.author: Zack Callahan
google_reviews.review: Kind, friendly, easy process. Prepared for questions and information.

google_reviews.author: S Callister
google_reviews.review: I co-signed for my son & his girlfriend to rent a small house in Bellingham while they were students. Though we were braced for difficulties because of some of the bad reviews, Landmark turned out to be just fine and very fair to work with. Yes, they have fairly strict requirements to be eligible to rent or co-sign, but I dont blame them - they have to protect their own interejsts and their property owners.  Their lease is also fairly thorough and strict, but as someone who once had a property of my own mistreated by tenants, I applaud that they require their tenants to take proper care of their rental, leave it in as good a condition as they found it, and be decent neighbors while they live there. Thats really what it comes down to. I was professional and polite in dealing with them, and I received the same from them. They even offered to adjust the term of the lease so it would coincide with the end of the academic year. At one point we needed to have something done to property to facilitate the type of internet we wanted, We followed proper procedure and requested permission, and they were quick to respond and supportive.  The only reason I gave them 4 rather than 5 stars was I thought the extra administrative fee charged at the beginning was steep (I understand there are costs associated with new tenants/leases, but in my opinion it seems like that should be borne by the propery owner who is paying the mgt company to rent the property for him/her - though I should add that all the mgt companies in this area seem to do this); additionally, the property was not cleaned all that well prior to move-in (Im a perfectionist about that), and there were a couple of things that really needed refurbishing: the finish on the tub was gone to the point it wasnt possible to clean it well, and the kitchen range needed refurbishing, e.g. temp markings worn off on the oven dial so no way to set oven to specific temp  (not unusual in older places, and more of a property owner issue). But - we were very thorough and detailed in documenting the condition of everything at move-in, again at move-out (when we worked hard to clean as well as humanly possible - as all tenants should), and we had no trouble getting back the majority of the deposit (less carpet cleaning costs, which they tell you from the beginning they will deduct). Bottom line, I felt they simply want tenants to behave like responsible, polite adults (as I would want if I was the mgt co. or property owner), to follow certain procedures (like communicating in writing, which protects both sides), and they would respond in kind.

ownerResponse.text: Shannon, thank you so much for your genuinely honest review. We do our best to provide fair and professional services to all our tenants, but that in fact is a two way street. We ask that tenants be responsible and respectable when it comes to their units. In addition to being communicative and understanding regarding any issues or problems that arise; so that we can do our best to accommodate all their needs and the needs of thousands of other tenants we provide services to as well.

google_reviews.author: Avery Smith
google_reviews.review: Absolutely horrible with maintenance and keeping things livable. They don't help with anything.They didn't clean the carpets or even the countertops when i moved in. There is giant rats living in the garbage cans and they don't pick up the garbage every week so it just smells horrible all the time. Fleas infested my apartment and i called their emergency line to take care of it and they apparently don't deal with pest control. (I have no pets by the way so the fleas must have come from someone down the hall or the previous tenant who owned a dog as a result of them not cleaning the carpets before I moved in.) No one ever communicates back to you, maintenance people enter your apartment without notice or warning even though specifically asked. It is just the most frustrating place to live.

ownerResponse.text: Avery, we're sorry to see you had a negative experience during move-in. Can you please email our property manager director, Kim, to discuss the issues you raised here; we'd like to learn more! kim@visitlandmark.com

google_reviews.author: Evan Turner
google_reviews.review: A week before my scheduled showing the agent texted (I never was able to talk with anyone by phone) and said she was no longer working at the property. She wouldnt say whether it was still available or if I still had an appointment. For contact info she sent the general company email and website. The listing is no longer on their website. So in my (frustrating) experience this is an unhelpful and flaky company with poor service and communication.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Evan, sorry for your horrible experience working with our artificial intelligence software which we have disabled as of yesterday. If you would like schedule a showing going forward it would be directly through our website or calling our office, 360-738-1022. Good luck in your search!

google_reviews.author: Candace Severson
google_reviews.review:
My experience with Landmark Real Estate Management was shall we say, HORRIBLE.

I have considerable experience in property management, over thirty years. These people are unfair and unscrupulous. Believe all the reviews, they are exactly like my experience.  Landmark does indeed keep all the damage deposit, and then some. Even after the property is left in better condition than when it is first rented.

I am hiring an attorney and hope at least partially stops these people from what they do to everyone that walks in the door to rent property from them.

google_reviews.author: Sarahbeth Bede
google_reviews.review: Easy enough to deal with so far. We have been here two weeks and honestly chose this place because of the on site manager at Tullwood. Amy is amazing and helpful and accommodating and understanding. Maintenance has been fast. I will update my review in a few months.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Sarahbeth, thank you for the 4 star review and appreciate your honesty. Please keep us posted on your experience we would love to know where we can improve!

google_reviews.author: Burnt- Knee
google_reviews.review: Had a great experience working with Tia. Was very helpful.

google_reviews.author: vintageseattle
google_reviews.review: My son lives in a rental managed by them. The heat just got fixed after being off for a month in late Fall.  They should get their act together! And by the way I am a real estate broker and a landlord myself and there is an old saying that someone at Landmark Property Management needs to teach their employees and review for themselves: do unto others as you would have them do unto you.  We tenants and family of students pay the bills and pay your staff and apparently will be fined if the rent is late--it looks like it is time for Landmark to pay a fine to US for intolerable tardiness in fixing things.

google_reviews.author: rygu
google_reviews.review: The folks in the office are kind. But this company has caused me so much unnecessary trouble in the past that it really illustrates that they don't communicate or do their jobs. Also, our place was vacant for several months before we rented it, so they had ample time to clean and update it. Instead when moving in, we had to clean it (when they said they did) and deal with maintenance guys coming by periodically for the first 4 months, often without any warning from landmark. The dryer was a serious fire hazard that we had to discover and report, rather than them do a inspection of their own property. Sidenote, the maintenance guys were all very pleasant. The real problem is Landmark is a business that has no concern for the tenants welfare and to describe in a single word-CORRUPT! Sadly, from my experience every property management company in Bham seems the same.

google_reviews.author: Nathan Rosenbaum
google_reviews.review: Landmark has managed my multifamily property in Bellingham for about three years, and has done an excellent job.  They proactively take care of tenants, and make thoughtful suggestions on how to add value to properties.  I heartily recommend them.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for the kind review, Nathan! It fills us with joy to hear that we've helped you add value to your properties.

google_reviews.author: Maddie Musquiz
google_reviews.review: Landmark has been super helpful all around and is really on top of things which always makes a great first impression! Amber has been such a help to me and is always readily available to answer any questions that come up!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Maddie, thank you for the 5 stars and the kind feedback about our team!

google_reviews.author: Holly Lyn
google_reviews.review:
Terrible company that scams college kids. Avoid at all costs. It took them 6 months after I moved out, even after giving them my intent to vacate 90 days in advance, they completely ignored it and forced me to stay on the lease for nearly 6 months after I moved out and even after the new tenants moved in. The lease ended and they didn't write a new one so I was kept as a contact and a liable person without my permission and was constantly getting calls and emails about maintenance requests for months after. They break the laws all the time and get away with it because they rent mostly to students who don't know their rights. They also include some sort of owners fee to your rent which is illegal. And they make you include renters insurance in your rent which is optional but they don't tell you that. Scam scam scam, avoid at all costs.

*In response to the owners response: First of all, those are NOT the only contacts I have had with you all, blatant lie right there. I did not text you in April, I came in in person and spoke with a lady named Grace and one other woman because I KNOW how unorganized you all are and have never had any luck communicating with you guys over the phone of email so I have gotten into the habit of just coming in in person as to not waste my time. Also, as you can see from the picture added, You guys were sending me emails and I was getting hassled with calls regarding maintenance requests up until the END of October 2018. I moved out, and gave my intent to vacate with this exact date: July 3 2018, IN APRIL. The lease for that address ENDED 8/20ish/18. I should have been off the lease and done with you guys THAT DATE at the latest, the last week in August because that was when the lease ENDED. I continued to be the held liable, constantly getting calls and bothered by contractors trying to fix the bathroom because both the toilets were broken. I hadn't lived there for three months and I knew all this was going on because of Landmark being negligent. The only way I was FINALLY able to get off the lease and being a current contact for this address was by this email sent on Oct 26th 2018, I responded and gave them a terrible review and they responded and FINALLY got me removed around 10/26/18, when I had moved OUT ON 7/3/18 and the lease ENDED 8/20/18 and I was continued to get calls and emails till the end of October! How is that acceptable?! No excuses. This is negligent and unacceptable. I will always tell people to steer clear, especially college kids, they pray on the young and threaten to kick you out if you don't give up and do what they say. And it is ILLEGAL to make tenants pay for renters insurance. It's a choice, and is not something that is just added to your rent. There is a $3 owners free and a $12 renters insurance fee that is added to every months rent in the portal. If tenants what renters insurance, like you said, THEY can seek out a renters insurance policy IF THEY'D LIKE. But to add it to rent is illegal and the only reason you guys are doing that is to cover yourself. Which is illegal. Someone please audit this company soon what they are doing is a crime... Can't keep operating like this and think no one will say something. I am so thankful I am not tied up with this company anymore.

****If you are not sure about your rights as a renter in this town, please refer to the second picture posted. These are some resources I have found that could save you from corrupt companies like Landmark. YOU HAVE RENTERS RIGHTS! Stay educated! And reach out to these sources if you have any questions!****

ownerResponse.text: Hi Holly, it looks like the only reason you were emailed for the COT Agreement is because it still needed to be signed. We sent that document on 8/8/18 and it wasnt executed until 9/14/18. The only other communication we had from you was a text on 4/27 when you informed us you were planning on moving out and asked what needed to be done. We sent a follow up text asking if someone was taking over your lease which we received no response to. We then sent two texts in July reminding you that we still needed you and your roommates to sign the COT. As for the Owner Fee there is no such thing that we charge we do require a liability insurance, which is a policy that can be obtained from any insurance company.

google_reviews.author: runaway_d0gie
google_reviews.review: We nevr had any trouble from them. But we recently move out of one of there rentals. We paid $ 1,000 deposit. We shampooed carpets replaced the oven liner cleaned the house. Now they say we owe $1,656.00. For a whole bunch of crap. We didn't even get any of our other deposit back last time either. I recommend not renting from them. This will be our last time. Anmd also do a walk in inspection with then before and after. Cu z they say there was damages to the downstairs sliding door.

google_reviews.author: Thy Nguyen
google_reviews.review: I never write reviews for anything but I've had it to the last straw with this property management. They are not helpful or considerate of their clients. I've had 6 property showings canceled now because they seem to not understand how to update their website for available properties. They tell you to look for available properties online and schedule online, but 90% of the time, the properties on their website are already taken before you can even apply or schedule for a showing. When you call them, they put you on hold for usually 10-15 minutes and if you're lucky, they might remember you're still on the other line and get back to you, but good luck with that. I can count on one hand how many times they have actually helped me out. I'm a college student who has been looking for properties with this management for 4 months now and it's a sad reality that I will not have a place to stay for the upcoming school year. I've learned my lesson and it was costly.

google_reviews.author: Johnnie Sparks
google_reviews.review: Landmark and Tullwood has made my experience getting my first apartment- and my move back to Bellingham from Phoenix- easy and smooth. I am grateful for all the help from everybody and I highly recommend Landmark Property Management to anybody looking. PS please get a more organized parking lot.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Johnnie, we're so glad to hear that you had a great experience working with us. Welcome back to Bellingham!

google_reviews.author: Kaylee Smith
google_reviews.review:
Worst rental company in whatcom county. I would never in my life even give them one star but Google doesnt give an option for less. We lived in a landmark property for a year and it was the worst experience I've ever had with a rental company, from being completely ignored by our property manager Brittney (everytime I email/call or text I'm ignored till i go into the office) i had Hope's for there new employees only to find out they are just as un trained as everyone else in there. I have hundreds of examples as to why you shouldn't rent from them but I dont have time to list them all. Take my word and dont do it.
EDIT UPDATE:6/19/19
STILL out hear emailing and trying to get ahold of "Brittney the property maneger" we had and still havent got our deposits or any information at all. As for the bullshiter who responds for landmark screw off I have proof in emails/ and records.
I will update again.

ownerResponse.text:
Hi Kaylee,

Im sorry to hear you had an unpleasant experience with us. We care deeply about our tenants and we try to do everything in our power to ensure they all have a great renting experience with us. Our records indicate that you submitted a work order which we then passed on to the owner of your property. Other than that our records do not show any other issues or complaints regarding your property or our services. That being said, if there are ever any issues with the property or our services please let us know right away. As you can imagine we manage a number of properties in Whatcom County so at times it may seem like we are taking longer than one would like to respond or deal with the issue at hand. All we ask is that our clients be mindful and patient while we do our best to respond/solve any issues. Again, Im sorry about your experience, we take these reviews to heart and will do our best to learn from them.

google_reviews.author: Cass Davis
google_reviews.review: I would never rent from this company again. They do not care about their tenants- they care about money. Don't expect them to work with you on anything, and make sure you document EVERYTHING if you end up having to rent from here. Honestly, you'd think that during a pandemic they would care a little bit more about their tenants and their financial situation rather than nitpicking about money, but don't expect that from these folks.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Cass, we really appreciate your feedback with your review. If you would like to reach out to our office and discuss your dissatisfaction further please call 360-738-1022 ext. 111

google_reviews.author: John Coleman
google_reviews.review: Landmark has managed my families portfolio of investment real estate for over 20 years.  The company provides excellent service and communication. Reporting is clear and accurate. I would not hesistate to recommend Landmark for anyones property management needs - big or small.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for the kind review, John! We've enjoyed working with you and your family these past 20 years, we look forward to 20 more!

google_reviews.author: Chrystal Carter
google_reviews.review: This company is horrible! My husband and I tried setting up numerous appointments to see a property but every time at the last minute they cancelled on us. We once again were trying to set up an appointment to see the property only to learn that someone else has already put down the security deposit and its no longer available. They did absolutely nothing to try and make up for the times we had set up the appointment and basically told us we were S.O.L! We will never try to go through this company we will go through someone else now.

ownerResponse.text:
Hi Chrystal,  We are truly sorry you were not able to see the property that you were interested in because there was already a holding fee put down on that unit.
I also went through all of our scheduled showings for the past month and never came across your name in our system. We do have a process in place for how we schedule our showings. The two options are going to our website under the vacancy tab where you can schedule a showing on your own or you can call the front desk at any time Monday through Friday, 8 am to 5 pm and they will schedule the showing for you over the phone. Our office manager was more than happy to explain all of this over the phone to you before ending the call abruptly. We wish you luck in your future search for a rental property!

google_reviews.author: amber machado
google_reviews.review: I wouldn't let the reviews be a deciding factor for this rental company, I have rented through Landmark for over a year, never have had an issue, all of my maintenance requests have been handled within a day or so! Super friendly and have awesome properties available!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Amber, thank you so much for the kind review! I'm happy to hear that all your maintenance requests are being handled in a speedy fashion. :D

google_reviews.author: LiAn Noonan
google_reviews.review: There was a hornets nest the day I moved in and the house was dirty and the sink was broken. When I called about the hornets and said there was a bubble in the ceiling the lady scoffed and said it was probably water damage. The pest control came in the next day (because I urgently called) and said the only thing separating the hornets from me was a thin layer of paint. Also, the property manager (Sarah-Lynn) has yet to speak to me one-on-one, even though she was in office when I called and keeps making her poor front desk lady deal with issues I would personally like to notify her of (for example, the hole in my ceiling that contains a colony of hornets and is currently on day 5 of being held up by scotch tape). Overall I have not had a great experience and its barely been over a week since Ive moved in.

ownerResponse.text: Hi LiAn, it appears that our team member, Sarah spoke to you directly the very same day the work order was submitted. The work order was then sent to another member of our team, Joe, within hours of receiving it. Joe then visited your house the very next day to examine the issue and informed us that it was in fact a hornets nest and that we should wait a few days before sending someone out to patch it up. A work order was sent out that Friday to have the ceiling patched up on the 14th and the entire household was contacted to inform you all that Northwest Renovations would be out there on the 14th to patch up the ceiling.We're doing everything in our power to resolve this issue for you and your roommates and we're sorry if you feel that isn't the case.

google_reviews.author: Von
google_reviews.review:
DO NOT RENT FROM LANDMARK. The lack of service we have recieved all year makes me question all real estate companies. All of our appliances are falling apart and we have recieved some of the worst repair service imagiable. Not only did it take two weeks for a repair man to show up, my bedroom window and garbage disposal have malfunctioned and no longer work. Still no word back on repairing it yet.

The point of this review is to warn any future buyers or renters, Landmark is THE worst realty business in Bellingham, you would have much better luck with Hammer or any other realitor for that matter. Good riddance Landmark, have fun with all the money you took from me.

google_reviews.author: Fredrick Solomon
google_reviews.review: The management and the apt are really good. Stayed in here for just six months. Did not have any concerning issues during those period. The management really help me with move in as well as when i move out. Thank you for building an hospitable environment.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you Fredrick for the nice review. We are so glad you enjoyed your tenancy with us!

google_reviews.author: Brittany Roper
google_reviews.review: It was a very positive and informative time. Thank you for your help.

google_reviews.author: Joel Garcia
google_reviews.review: I didnt quite meet all the requirements to get accepted from landmark which I now find quite great, glad it went that way because from what all Ive seen in the reviews they are right. Terrible  customer  Service. I got declined so that means I get my holding fee refunded and its been 1 month and they keep saying theyll get on it and yet I see nothing being done for me to get my money back. I keep calling and nothing is getting done, if you dont keep contacting them for such thing theyd probably forget to refund you back.

ownerResponse.text:
Hi Joel,
Please contact our office 360-738-1022 and ask for Kimberly Huizenga so we can look into this for you. I don't see your name  in our system so I'm not sure if you are writing on another applicants behalf. Our policy is to return holding fees within 48-hours of denial.

google_reviews.author: Stu Fales
google_reviews.review: My first rating was a 0....but then I went in after 3 months of not getting my final statement and they got rid of the "bad egg(s)" and have been replaced with a great new property manager, I think I would rent from here again now. They had one bad egg that screwed a lot of people over.

google_reviews.author: circuit-maker

ownerResponse.text:
Ian,

Our team totally understands that life happens. Individuals often need or want to change their roommate situation and we work with them to make that happen whenever possible.

Anytime there is a change in tenancy -- adding or removing individuals from the original lease document -- there is a process to follow. That process takes behind-the-scenes staff time, much of which is not seen by tenants when they do things like pick up keys or sign addendums.

It is the industry standard for property management companies to charge additional fees for that service -- Landmark's $250 change of tenancy fee is included and disclosed on all of our rental agreements.

We do hope you will enjoy living in your new rental home. If you have any additional questions about our rental agreements or administrative fees please contact our property management director, Kim, at  (360) 738-1022.

yelp_reviews.author: Zoe F.
yelp_reviews.review: I used to rent from landmark a couple of years ago. I ended up having a not so great experience with them initially. Since then, things have changed. The communication with staff was much more friendly and they were very helpful with my request. Great communication and super helpful.

yelp_reviews.author: Dawn V.
yelp_reviews.review:
Landmark appears to be only about the bottom line... more money.
They set up an online app for tenant approval that was a nightmare to use, especially for parents of college students. They had to get rid of that app within one year, but certainly didn't help those of us who were struggling.
The property is rundown. The rules about no smoking and pets are not enforced. There were bug problems that continued for several months. Smoke from neighbors smoking on their porches seeped into the apartment. There was a huge problem with the walkways along the 2nd story entrances. So many soft spots that I was concerned about dropping a foot through the walkway.  
I think of all the time and all the phone calls I have made over the last year for different problems.
Then, in the checkout process, we received approval to check out early. But this was never communicated to the Accounting department. So the Accounting department refused to honor the email approval we received from the property manager. We paid about $500 that they refused to refund.

This company seems very disorganized. And the employees do not seem very happy. Be very cautious if you decide to rent from them.

yelp_reviews.author: Matt L.
yelp_reviews.review:
If 0 stars was an option, I would definitely give them a 0. I can't believe this place is still in business after my terrible experience living in Bellingham. I urge you to consider going to another leasing company for your apartment rentals/leasing if you plan on settling in the Bellingham area. I know most Yelp review pages for leasing companies will have negative reviews but I HIGHLY encourage you to read about my experience and consider going to another company when looking for Bellingham apartments/houses.

When I moved into my apartment, I was appalled that they said that they cleaned and fixed the apartment. OK, I'm a pretty clean person but who says the apartment is considered fixed when there are holes punched into the door... Not only did we take photos of this but we reported this immediately to the leasing company and it took them 2-3 months for them to finally fix the doors.  

Now, moving out I'm so appalled at this and to this day I am appalled. Our security deposit was around $800. We made sure the apartment was cleaned spotless, even better than when we moved in. Everything was fixed and tidy with no damages. We got back $24. All I said was "LOL are you serious?" I was so shocked at this. Did they change the carpets? Fix the blinds?  Redid the kitchen with this?!? We called so many times about this and they said they were going to look into this and we finally got an answer saying that there was damage to the apartment case closed. I'm so confused at this and still to this day as we left the apartment in better condition than before. In the end, fighting this for months after we moved out was not worth $300+ of my share of the deposit as we would always get told that a message will be taken and a call will never get returned to us...

I've rented from now 5 places and this is by far the worst company I've ever leased apartments from. Even if you find the perfect apartment complex and it's through them, I want to urge you to find another place to rent from. If you choose to rent from Landmark, you better document everything with your phone (including photos and videos) of when you move in and out and ask for a final ledger upon move out. PLEASE PLEASE find another place. Now I know why the previous tenants left those holes in the apartment (see photos) and I would have probably done it too after all the frustration I faced leasing from Landmark.

yelp_reviews.author: Kimberly B.
yelp_reviews.review: I was honestly surprised that I got my deposit back, since I've heard horror stories about property management companies not giving it back, especially in Bellingham. However, regardless of the showing mishaps, i found that it was an overall positive move out experience. I got my deposit on time, I didn't have any trouble after the showing situation. I will be looking to rent from them again. Also, when you go into the office, they're very helpful I found.

yelp_reviews.author: Simon L.
yelp_reviews.review:
Landmark realty Management it's definitely mismanaged themselves and made a poor choice in letting go of one of the best on-site managers there is. 
This wonderful on-site manager managed two buildings and always went the extra mile to make sure all of her tenants were safe and secure she gave all of her tenants a sense of security and making sure everyone was taken care of and put her love and kindness into each and every one of them. She always made sure that all of her tenants were safe from all of the homeless encampments where there was crime prostitution drug use and drug dealing including the massive behavioral problems that threatened each and every tenant. She always made sure that everyone felt safe to the point where everyone is happy to call the tollwood apartments their home. 
Landmark should be ashamed of themselves for not seeing the valuable asset of the on site manager that will always be remembered and missed.

yelp_reviews.author: Kat M.
yelp_reviews.review:
Do not be deceived by the seemingly nice properties Landmark owns. I have been a tenant with Landmark for about 7 months now. The entire experience has been nothing short of frustrating and overall exhausting. We will not be renewing our lease here when the lease is up.

I do not know where to even begin with these people. The property manager we deal with is Grace Macdonald. Both room mate and I have not liked this lady from the get go. We moved to Bellingham with the hopes of finding something nicer than our old place and we settled for the place we have now with Landmark. The apartments themselves are decent and fairly new, but the management makes it so that the apartment quality isn't even worthwhile.

Let us start with how unprofessional the landlord is. Every other day or so, we get texts that sound like a third grader wrote them. We have been asked to basically spy on our neighbors and be snitches on each other for Grace. Everything, from literal begging and pleading, to how to park cars etc, is texted about all the time. It seems as though she cannot properly manage her property well at all. Do not think any complaints or maintenance you have will be handled at all. We have been waiting for our washing machine to be fixed for four months now. Still nothing from them. We have neighbors above who stomp louder than elephants and we were essentially told to suck it up when we asked if they could message the people about sound etiquette. But only week one into our stay and we already had Landmark messaging us to be more quiet.

The apartments are nice... in the winter and winter only. They are equipped with heaters in all rooms. But in the summertime, these apartments will make you feel like you are in a slow cooker. NO AC whatsoever. Be prepared to drop $400 on an AC unit for your place. The apartments are on the expensive end. 2 bed and 1 bath is close to $2000 every month, including all utilities. We are broke. the bedrooms are also small as hell. The security deposits and pet fees are outrageous too! Each cat is $500 and an additional $40 every month to your already ludicrously expensive rent.

There are no amenities at all. No covered parking, no garages, no pool, no gym, no clubhouse. You get the idea. What you DO get offered by Landmark is a gardening plot and paid parking spots. But, as the name suggests, they are paid for monthly. So, in addition to expensive rent, you can pay $60/month for a parking spot no closer than 95% of the parking and $30/month for a box of dirt. Money greedy.

Bottom line, living here has felt like being watched over by the Gestapo - Landmark cares solely about money and making their tenants miserably controlled. Never renting from these people again.

yelp_reviews.author: Jerrod L.
yelp_reviews.review: the worst rental company I have ever worked with. only care about money and don't care about tenants. I rented from them last year and made sure to stay away just for them to buy the building I'm in. they are now raising rent from $1400 to $1860 on top of $50 for a parking spot. they also lost a month of rent in the transition and instead of reaching out they sent an eviction notice. if you can stay away

yelp_reviews.author: Ali M.
yelp_reviews.review:
I have had the most frustrating experience with this company.  I applied for a 2 bdrm apartment in the SAME complex to upgrade from a 1 bdrm I had been renting for a year.  I applied on May 25th and did not get an approval until 6/24 to get keys THE NEXT DAY.  I had spent weeks asking for updates so I would know whether to start cleaning and packing.  Their stupid online application system makes it very difficult when getting an ESA animal approved...even though my dog had lived with me on an approved status for the last year!  My letter was 13 months old and they wanted one within the last 12 months.  The online portal was locked from edits, but Landmark would NOT accept an email of the letter.  The whole thing was NOT my fault.

And then....with 5 days to move in record setting heat wave, I asked for an additional couple days to have a hidebed couch taken out by Habitat for Humanity.  They gave me until July 1st.  Not helpeful.  It is 8/21/21 today and my old apartment still sits empty.

Then they charged me 6 additional days of rent in July as well as 8 hours of cleaning!  They place was awfully cleaning but for some cleaning residue and a few bits on debris on the floor that likely blew in as they opened the door!  

I disputed the refund amount and got back half of what I was asking for accompanied by a bitchy email from Cherise.  Also, my coworker is going through the exact same thing with not knowing about approval DAYS before trying to move and many phone calls not being returned timely.

yelp_reviews.author: Devon D.
yelp_reviews.review:
There are a lot of opinions about Landmark out there, I will leave my review based solely on factual occurrences: 

1. I moved out and moved into a new Landmark property. Well over 21 days passed and no deposit or statement of fixes was given. When I inquired after a couple months, they sent me a check for just over $10.00. I followed up with a demand letter for entire deposit citing the RCW they were blatantly attempting to violate, they refunded the full deposit within one week.

2. When moving out of our last place after buying a home, I wanted to make sure they still had the move in inspection form we signed; they legally need to have a copy on file to be able to keep some/all of a damage deposit and they also are legally required to provide a tenant one copy when asked during that tenants tenancy.

When we asked for a copy, we were told it wasn't available, it was filed away in storage off site, they had switched from paper files to digital since we moved in and they may not have it at all and they'd have to get back to us a different day, etc. After a rather large commotion and being threatened to have the cops called on us for harassment because we knew exactly what we were entitled to (we actually offered to call our family friend for them who is a sheriffs deputy on duty at the time, they declined) they conveniently sent over the electronic pdf of the document via email within literally 21 minutes of us leaving the office. Very impressive if it was indeed a hard copy only stored offsite like they stated. 

There were some other instances of subpar property management, but these two situations told me everything I need to know about how they do business. There is a reason they are one of the worst reviewed property management companies in Whatcom county.

yelp_reviews.author: Alexander T.
yelp_reviews.review: Landmark is the commercial property manager for our restaurant. They have consistently failed to perform the basic legal requirements of their position for over a year now. From messing up mailing addresses, not providing necessary keys to our space and to our mail box, and not responding to urgent calls, emails and maintenance requests. I am not exaggerating when I say they are the most incompetent organization I have ever interacted with on a professional level. We have had to resort to contacting the city to inform Landmark of their responsibilities, specifically regarding incompetence and carelessness with mailing addresses which are in fact a vital and legally required aspect of a business's operations.

yelp_reviews.author: Nevy B.
yelp_reviews.review: NEVER AGAIN!  I plan on suing them. They don't care about their tenants. God forbid something catastrophic happen to your unit, you are on your own. I was displaced and had to incur all of the moving expenses myself because no one would take responsibility. There is a blame game between them and the HOA. They are horrible and shouldn't be allowed to be in business.

yelp_reviews.author: Hally O.
yelp_reviews.review:
Absolutely terrible, Laura Magi may only be a property manager but she is a slum lord. From no toilet for a whole month to a hole in our ceiling and now our house flooding. Constantly reassigned managers and neglected left and right when requests are made. This property is not up to code and they are making us live through a nightmare. They take advantage of young college students and strip you of money. They all have the worst attitudes when addressing any situation. I cannot stress enough how absolutely terrible this leasing company is. THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT TENANTS.

This is a Bellingham location.

yelp_reviews.author: Matt K.
yelp_reviews.review:
I am giving Landmark 1 star because at least they offer people places to live.

I have been renting the same apartment for 3 years now and have watched the cost steadily increase and the customer service decrease at the same rate. In the past 3 years, rent has gone up $300 dollars and they claim it is for the property taxes, with as many units as they have in my complex, they more than quadrupled the rising property tax. 

My first year, we put in a request to get the fan above our stove fixed. After being ignored for a month, we put in another one. Fast forward to 3 months later and we just fixed it ourselves because Landmark is incompetent.

The company does not care about the people that rent their units. Landmark simply wants to make money of college students and put them through the ringer. Constant threats made by employees were ridiculous and how they manage their properties is disgusting. My one piece of advice to anyone looking at renting in Bellingham is to literally choose anyone company but Landmark.

yelp_reviews.author: Rebecca C.
yelp_reviews.review:
Landmark is a bare-bones management company. They will fix little things in a reasonable time frame, but anything else takes weeks or doesn't happen. 

They charge fees for everything. Be mindful of every entry because they frequently over charge. They do correct their error with a quick "oh, sorry, our accountants must have made a mistake, we will fix that"...but will do so multiple months in a row. 

If you have fees noted in your lease (water bill, insurance, etc) be extra cautious. They charge many in   "error" and include a "service fee" for their entry of the initial fee being charged. The entry fee is only $3, but it's still frustrating to be changed a fee for them to enter a fee.

Water management is also really sketchy. There's only one meter on the our four-plex, so they charge a "water fee" and divide the bill based on square footage and number of people in the house, but will routinely "miscalculate" and overcharge. Ex: We were charged $136 for one month of use in our apartment, and when we asked if we could see the bill they said "no", but noted that they had overcharged, and then lowered the fee to $90. We've since asked to see the bill on three additional occasions and they've said "no". 

We will avoid renting with Landmark in the future.

yelp_reviews.author: Jade M.
yelp_reviews.review: literally can't get my esa letters approved, they want more information when these are literally legal documents. what the hell

yelp_reviews.author: Michelle R.
yelp_reviews.review:
When my roommates and I first started renting with Landmark in July, we were thrilled by the close location to WWU and low rent. This enthusiasm for this company has quickly faded as each encounter we have had with them has been both frustrating and the staff have proven to be disingenuous. 

When asked to fix the collapsing counter in our apartment, we were told that it would be taken care of. On further inspection after it was "fixed" screws had been put into the base of the counter, but weren't actually attached in place to keep it steady. On first glance it looked as if it was fixed when actually no support had been given at all.

As a company, Landmark has proven time and time again that it does not care for its tenants. Every exchange through this company has been through text, impersonal, and has always included a threat. When trees were being taken down in the northern parking lot, instead of being asked to move our cars we were simply informed that if they weren't moved by the next day they would be towed. 

Although that example might seem pretty innocuous, it's a behavior that is repeated almost every time we have any interaction with them. When rent was due recently, my account that is set on autopay originally took the money from my account, but bounced it from the system the same day. Instead of alerting me to this by email, call, or text, Landmark instead taped an eviction notice to our door. Once I fixed this error with rent we were then slapped with a fee of over $100. Now while I understand the fee the real frustration has come from trying to talk to staff at Landmark.

Customer service has been unhelpful and more willing to threaten tenants than actually provide a semblance of sympathy. I know I can't tell anyone where to rent from, but my experience here has been incredibly disappointing.

ownerResponse.text: Michelle, please accept our apologies for the experiences you shared, and thank you for bringing these concerns to our attention in a thoughtful manner. We are continuously working to refine processes and to improve customer relations while also fully complying with governmental regulations related to tenant laws and property management operations. There's always more to learn and more to do in those areas. Know that improving customer service is a priority for our business.

yelp_reviews.author: Charlie C.
yelp_reviews.review: Complete neglect of property. The apartment complex I live in is less than 10 years old and it is in embarrassingly poor condition. Management never sends cleaners to take care of common areas and grounds. I feel like I can't invite people over because the hallways and grounds are so shamefully dirty.

ownerResponse.text: We appreciate your feedback, Charlie; have you contacted our office directly about this matter? It's not clear which building you live in so we'll need more info. Landmark is a management company, which means most repair and maintenance requests require communication with the property owner, who needs to approve the request. You can submit requests and/or report issues via Landmark's tenant portal (contact us if you don't have access to that yet!) or by calling our office. Details here: https://www.visitlandmark.com/handle-maintenance-requests/

yelp_reviews.author: Chloe H.
yelp_reviews.review: After sending in and paying for an application, we found out that the listing was already off the market. At least 7 other listings that were marked as "available" on their website were also off the market, so we could not put our application to a different property. Very disappointed at the wasted money, and annoyed that Landmark would list properties that were not taking applications.

yelp_reviews.author: Aditya K.
yelp_reviews.review: by-far this is the worst property management  group with whom I have ever stayed, The reception group treats us in a disguising way someone would ever imagine, and these guys are through thugs where clearing deposit amount is concern, they will show us incorrect and irrelevant  bills and cut-down the deposit amount to atleast 50%, I have never seen someone getting more than 50% of their deposit amount in my group though we keep the house neat and clean without any defects. Hope I can give them some negative reviews. I know these guys will come up with some silly explanation to this review but I request the reader to believe what I said in the review.

yelp_reviews.author: Jessica T.
yelp_reviews.review: DO NOT EVEN APPLY - I have not even lived in a unit leased from Landmark Real Estate and yet I have 7,000 different complaints for this company. The phone number that they give as their point of contact never reaches an actual person, you must always leave a message. Many units are not properly labeled (some will be labeled as "studio" but you WILL be sharing everything!!!!) and parts of the website say "pets OK" and some parts say no pets (I have screenshots of this). Horrible photos are presented of the older units, and many units are masked with the caption "*Note: Photos may not depict exact unit(s) available".  How do I know what I am applying for?? I live out of the state and find it completely unnerving that they do not feel the need to include actual photos. This company is a scam and a catfish. Do not let them take your $45 application fee, as they will run to the hills with it. I will never  forget about this terrible experience I have had with this company. Doing a deep-dive on this company and it is not looking good for them.

yelp_reviews.author: Fredric G.
yelp_reviews.review: I was a tenant at a landmark property from November 2020 to September 2021. I am absolutely appalled at what others, including myself, have been through in dealing with these sharks. First of all, the main office is ridiculously unresponsive and you have to call them seemingly dozens of times in order for them to even reliably pick up and answer your call, even during stated business hours. Secondly, the terms in our lease at Sophia Place were ridiculously unreasonable. They can (and will) nickel and dime you for everything they possibly can. Want a garden plot? $50 security deposit and then $30 a month. Paid parking? $60 a month for a spot no closer than 95% of the rest of the parking spots. Also, be prepared to empty your bank account if you have pets, and the deposits are NOT STATED on the website. In case anybody was wondering, it's $500 per pet for a security deposit followed by $40 a month thereafter per pet. Speaking of prices, the cost of rent is absolutely unaffordable. By the time we moved out, we were paying almost $2000 a month including utilities and pet rent and all of that jazz for our 805 square-foot apartment. The base rent for Sophia Place got jacked up as well. It used to be $1500 a month for ours, and if we hadn't moved out, it would have been $1605 a month. Also, they do not do month to month leases. So if your lease is about to expire and you can't find another place to go, tough luck, you will have to sign for another several months, if not a year. It's whatever they decide. Also, forget about getting your security deposit back. You will never see it again, even if you make your apartment shine brighter than the surface of the sun. The staff themselves are extremely rude and sound like they absolutely hate their jobs, and the ones that don't sound like they are very clearly faking a positive attitude. If you can, please find somewhere else to live in Bellingham. It's sad that seemingly every other property in that area is owned by Landmark so it doesn't give you many options. Don't do it. Just don't do it.

yelp_reviews.author: Hannah O.
yelp_reviews.review: I would give zero stars if I could. This was my first experience living in my own apartment and landmark single-handedly ruined it. They do not take care of their facilities or tenants. Their parking lots are littered with trash. Their buildings are falling apart. They do not attend quickly to maintenance requests. They randomly raised rent TWICE throughout my short stay with them. Also, they randomly started billing me for water and sewage even though it is not in my lease agreement. Once I called them out for it, they stopped billing me but took the $70 I had already paid them. My car was literally towed by them from my own apartment complex, and I had to pay several hundred dollars to get it back. I could go on and on. The point is, landmark is a horrible rental company. They are only trying to take advantage of college students and steal their money.

yelp_reviews.author: Lizzie S.
yelp_reviews.review: Having lived in Landmark property for the past two years I've had a positive experience with them. They respond in a timely manner when emailed and usually answer calls. Their staff is helpful and engaged. I appreciated their extra patience and kindness when I first moved off campus, they took time to explain paperwork and gladly answered my many questions. This is why I continue to live and enjoy Landmark's management.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for recognizing our staff in positive ways, Lizzie. Your feedback means a lot to our team who work hard every day to take care of those we serve.

yelp_reviews.author: Marc M.
yelp_reviews.review:
I lived at Centre Pointe which is a fairly new condo building in Bellingham.  Landmark serves as the property manager for an individual that owns an entire building.  The units are clean and kept very well.  When I moved in, there were multiple minor issues that needed to be addressed including a broken exterior window in the master bedroom.  It took Landmark 2.5 months to have the glass replaced.

When I moved out a couple of months ago, I cleaned the place spotless as expected and outlined in the lease agreement.  This was also noted by Landmark in the YouTube video they record while performing the move out inspection.  The only issue was noted as being some minor dust on the marble counter tops in kitchen and bathroom.  They ended up charging me a cleaning fee that was deducted from my deposit.

Lesson learned and bottom line (and what I have heard about all property management companies in Bellingham), be prepared as they will keep a portion of your deposit no matter what.  There is nothing you can do unless you want to take them to court.

yelp_reviews.author: M D.
yelp_reviews.review: Worst company in Bellingham. They put a bunch of properties on their website that aren't available. When I submitted the application (wanting to be the first person to get the place), they said it had already been sold. They then refused to give me my $90 back. Meanwhile, other real estate companies have had great customer service and refunded it right away because they didn't take down the homes from their website. All you get is an automated email, not addressed to you, saying no refunds.

yelp_reviews.author: Mark A.
yelp_reviews.review:
I had made an appointment with someone over the phone to look at an apartment studio. I had to coordinate with work to leave early so I can look at it during their office hours.
The day of the appointment (2 days later) I receive a phone call two hours before the appointment to confirm. I'm able to confirm that I'll be there. They offered me to pick up the key as long as I leave collateral, I agree I can do that. The girl on the phone confirms with her supervisor if that's okay to do, she gets the green light. 
I show up on time to my appointment to learn that the studio was already taken. Apparently someone came in with a holding fee before I got there. I understand first come first serve, however, they paid the holding fee an hour before they called me to confirm my appointment. Wildly unprofessional and inconsiderate. These landlord sharks are crippling affordable housing in Whatcom County.

yelp_reviews.author: L M.
yelp_reviews.review:
There is not one good thing to say about Landmark, any of their employees or owners..  They are slumlords who don't care about anything other than income.  The more the better.  I've never seen such greed in my lifetime.  
They don't care and they don't have to.  They have so many properties they can ask what they want for rent and get it.  If not you, they'll take anyone.  I used to have great neighbors until they took over managing.  Now?  Lock my doors and am not sure how many people live here.  They don't know either.  Twice as many people as the complex accommodates.  The grounds used to be kept up and were beautiful.  Now, it's an embarrassment.  Can't wait to get out of here and would like nothing more than for this company to be shut down! 
Do NOT RENT FROM LANDMARK.

yelp_reviews.author: Kierra H.
yelp_reviews.review:
Landmark is unprofessional and doesn't care about any of the people who they rent to. All they do is threaten their renters and rob them of their money. It's really messed up!!! Never ever will I rent from this crappy uncaring real estate. DO NOT RENT THR
OUGH THESE PEOPLE. ALL THEY WANT IS YOUR MONEY AND WILL THREATEN YOU IF YOU DONT GIVE THEM WHAT THEY ASK. they should be embarrassed and ashamed and whoever runs this place is an absolute idiot and clearly has their own personal problems that they bring to work and it just looks so bad. Would rather live in a 2 star hotel then rent through this awful real estate. -10 stars. Do better!

yelp_reviews.author: Jim A.
